eventname: Yoga wellness packages  in Rishikesh India
description:
Param Ananda – Experiencing Pure Bliss 15 Days & 14 Nights
Yoga & wellness Packages in Rishikesh India
15 days of living in ecstasy in ethnically designed cottages made of the purest natural material, aligning yourself to the cosmic geometry and becoming and truly feeling an extension of the universe with morning and evening Yoga sessions amidst pure nature with the roar of the river Ganges and chipping of the birds, and giving yourself a connect with your higher self in special evening meditation sessions to evolve to higher level of your existence as a human.

Imagine watching the rains from your balcony while having a morning tea, the touch of the clouds coming in to your room while you lie on your bed for an afternoon nap…..Waking up with chipping of birds and sleeping with the roar of the wild river Ganga flowing nearby…..

Starting your day with a hike in the adjacent reserve forests of Himalayan foothills and excursions to the highly energized & vibrated temples on the mountain tops and along the holy river Ganga to become receptive and feel pure vibes created by Yogis, Rishi’s & pilgrims coming to the area since time immemorial in search of peace and pure bliss.
Taking the day with Soft Asana classes & Going deep within with special Sattya Yoga sessions to address the deeper dimensions of yoga through rare meditation, relaxation and higher awareness sessions….

Pampering your body with special Ayurveda Massages & treatments with special Himalayan herbs freshly collected from the adjacent reserve forest and eating yogic food designed for you and made of organic supplies coming from the high Himalayan regions.

Come and experience silence amidst the sound of nature and make yourself still to dive deep within to explore your higher self and get connected, in order to transform and evolve to much higher level connecting to your soul and the universe to truly become one with it……

Come and widen your inner world on this special Yoga and wellness Package in Rishikesh India at Yogada in the Himalayas – A Ashram retreat to live the ancient science of Yoga and Ayurveda ……
For Course details & availability please email with your month of attending the course.
E-Mail — yogadahimalaya@gmail.com & yogada@rishikesh.in

eventname: 200 Hour Yoga Teacher Training in India
description:
Om Shanti Om Yoga School is one of the classical Yoga Schools in Rishikesh, India established in 1999 by world-famous Swami Yogananda Maharaj Ji (who achieved Maha Samadhi on 3rd January 2015, aged 106 years old).
Om Shanti Om Yoga School, a registered yoga school by Yoga Alliance, USA is situated in the scenic and sanctified city of Rishikesh. The school offers numerous yoga courses to all the yoga aspirants who are highly dedicated to this. The best part about the courses is that even beginners can join the course and start a new journey in the world of yoga. 

Why Yoga in Rishikesh?

Rishikesh is a holy city located on the foothills of the Garhwal Himalayas and on the banks of the River Ganga. The city is among the popular destinations for tourists and travelers around the world. People carrying different desires visit the city and enjoy the best of it, making everlasting memories. Be it about Adventure, Nature, Activities, Sightseeing, or Spirituality; the city has much to offer. 
Talking about the spiritual journey of Rishikesh, there are many accredited temples, ashrams, and pious places where you can calm your agitated soul and mind. There is a mention of \Rishikesh\" in \"Skanda Purana\". Having been blessed by the benediction of God
banner_url: the city is the perfect place to gain any spiritual knowledge or to heal completely (internally and externally).

event_id: While reading about this spiritual city
eventname: you might find it mentioned as the \"Yoga Capital of the World\". What does it mean? Going deeply into the ocean of knowledge of this place
start_time: you get to know that its roots are connected with yoga since ancient times. Many Rishi-Munis (Saints) visited here to attain salvation and peace. Further
timezone: many people visit here to understand the core of yoga and to spread its knowledge. The atmosphere of the city is powered by spirituality and peace that one can forget all one's worries and problems.

Located in Rishikesh is the biggest reason to opt for a yoga school. But as there are many yoga schools in Rishikesh
eventname: so there are some other points
start_time: you need to know about Om Shanti Om Yoga School

• The school follows the Gurukul style of teaching rather than modern teaching.
• Teachers at Om Shanti Om Yoga School not just hold a diploma in yoga teaching but are also connected to the core of it.
• The yoga institute doesn't follow a pressured teaching but smooth learning.
• Om Shanti Om Yoga School is located in such a location that it is well connected with temples
• There is no limit to teaching and learning and that's why you gurus here will teach until you learn.
• Teaching and learning is a pious practice
eventname: that's why RYT creates such a pious atmosphere while teaching that you will learn by keeping your soul happy and mind healthy.

event_id: • Combining the right diet with the right practice is very important and here you don't have to worry about this.

eventname: the staffs are highly humble; making the school; a perfect place to live and learn.

event_id: • Exploring is as much important as learning
start_time: the students are taken for outings and explore the best of Rishikesh.

event_id: • The syllabus and schedule are maintained as per the guidelines of Yoga Alliance
Yoga Teacher Training Courses at Om Shanti Om Yoga School
Yoga is the best activity and practice to relax the body
eventname: refresh the mind relieve the soul. The practice originated in India ages ago. Rishikesh
start_time: a city in Uttarakhand offers the perfect atmosphere and environment to learn and practice yoga and other spiritual activities. Whether you want to learn it for overall fitness and wellness or to start a journey in this pious field. Whether you search for complete peace or for the finest health practice. Whether you are just starting your yoga learning or holding years of experience in this; everyone can join the course.

description:
As our beloved Swami Veda Bharati has said, “The most profound teachings of the Tradition are in silence. The greatest growth of the human mind takes place in silence.”

Maunam Guided Silence Retreats

Come experience deeper levels of your inner self through the practice of silence. This six-day retreat, away from the business of daily life, will help you calm down the constant flow of random thoughts and emotions and rejuvenate yourself on all levels. This retreat includes two days of foundations and preparations to silence, three days of silence practice and introspection, as well as one day of sharing and assimilation.

“Silence is such a profound and deep experience of human existence that only when we have understood silence would we understand all the inspiration that has ever flowed to humanity from the minds and mouths of its great saints and sages.” – Swami Veda Bharati

eventname: FOUR SEASONS YOGA TEACHER TRAINING & YOGA COURSES. A UNIQUE MULTI-MODAL APPROACH TO LEARNING YOGA
description:
FOUR SEASONS YOGA TEACHER TRAINING & YOGA COURSES.
A UNIQUE MULTI-MODAL APPROACH TO LEARNING YOGA
OVER 4 UNIQUE WEEKS
RISHIKESH INDIA
24th SEPT - 22nd OCT 2022
With Dr Yamuna (Yan), Amit Mishra, & Guest teachers
www.fourseasonsyoga.org
A little bird tweeted this...
We have 4 UNIQUE WEEKS weaving together 4 distinct approaches to yoga giving students a balanced breadth of knowledge and experience.
Our Weeklong seasons include:
- Spring Jnana - Gentle therapeutic somatic, enquiring
- Summer Karma - strengthening vinyasa & ashtanga, advanced kriya
- Autumn Bhakti -Yin restorative-cooling pranayama-Surrender-Bhakti
- Winter Raja - Meditation, Chakra sadhana, Hatha meditative asana-Shoonya
Much more info is on our website here: https://fourseasonsyoga.org/yoga-training/

>>>>>>>>>>>>
Join us this September in Rishikesh India for 4 unique weeks of yoga practice and training together. You can join us for the whole month or for individual weeks.
Our yoga training programs are open to all, whether you are simply looking to gain knowledge to deepen your own personal yoga practice or gain experience to start sharing Yoga with others. If you are seeking to teach in future, it is suggested to have at least two years of consistent personal yoga practice before sharing with others professionally.
only 10 spots available and we have some amazing first grab and early bird offers.
more info at:
www.fourseasonsyoga.org
Our Yoga retreat season dates!
200hr Four Seasons Teacher Training
– 24 sept – 22nd oct –
– Spring Jnana course– 24 sept- 1 oct
– Summer Karma course – 1 – 8 oct
– Autumn Bhakti course – 8 – 15 oct
– Winter Raja course – 15 – 22 oct
ABOUT OUR UNIQUE YOGA SEASONS...
SPRING JNANA YOGA COURSE
HIGHLIGHTS:
Radical breath recovery series
Gentle Kriyas
Somatic & Therapeutic Yoga practice
Yoga alignment workshops
Self massage, diaphragm & psoas release techniques
Trauma healing & the nervous system
Anatomy of the breath
Jnana Yoga & the 5 Sheaths Kosha
Dynamic meditations
Yoga Nidra
Exactly as the name implies, spring is all about ‘springing’ back to life. The season runs from complete inertia to gradual bloom. The quality of energy is rising, reaching, expanding and flowering, becoming more colorful. It’s about coming out of our dormant form and slowly learning how to express ourselves again. This week teaches us how to be gentle with ourselves, to move slow, to cultivate greater awareness as we integrate into our bodies after a long period of rest, sedentary lifestyle or perhaps even injury.
In the Spring Jnana immersion, the focus and learning outcomes will be centered around super gentle, therapeutic and somatic forms of yoga and kriya practices. Practical sessions will explore the effects of ultra slow movement, shaking and releasing, Zero resistance movements, upa yoga preparations, isolated joint rotations, gentle mobilisation practices and propped and supported asanas allowing us to re-engage our bodies.
We will learn about the nervous system, interoception and the experience of the somatic body, along with somatic trauma healing techniques and how the principles of tracking, resourcing, pendulating, and grounding can be applied in our yoga practice.
Our radical breath recovery series will show you the power of simple breath techniques for recovering the function of the diaphragm, pelvic floor and abdominal muscles. We will have you understand the complex anatomy of the breath and body so that you have an awareness of the implication and effect of certain practices and postures.
We will detail the alignment and technique to be applied in each yoga posture and to see when and how to make adjustments and prop to gain maximum benefit of each asana.
We will introduce the philosophy and history of yoga and align you to its original meaning and purpose so that you can move forth with the correct outlook and intention.
The major theme of the week is self enquiry and re-integrating a deep awareness of everything that makes us human, our body, breath, emotions, mind, intellect, bliss nature and beyond all these sheaths, our eternal self. This season is about reintegration of all our parts.

SUMMER KARMA YOGA COURSE
HIGHLIGHTS:
Advanced abdominal Kriya series
Heating Vinyasa & Ashtanga Yoga
Bodyweight resistance training
How to be strong yet at ease
Vinyasa & Tristana theory
Correct Bandha technique
Yoga Sequencing workshops
Karma yoga
Musculoskeletal Anatomy
Advanced asana workshops
Evening cooling pranayama
Tranquilizing meditation practices
Summer is about being in full swing. You’ve broken out of your shell and you’re exploring what it feels like to shine and enjoy a good challenge. This season is about being at your peak and perhaps even challenging your limit for further expansion. Your body and energy are in good health and together we learn how to stay balanced, at ease and free from injury and burnout by understanding the stress - rest - regenerate cycle and how to move with ease and grace through practice and life challenges.
In the summer Karma immersions, we will move the group towards more heat generating practices with larger compound movements and greater emphasis on sun salutation and strengthening vinyasa practices, guiding students to align their movement with a clear awareness of the breath and its importance in practice, giving them insight into the need for breath moderation in order to understand that breath maintenance is central to maintaining steadiness and ease in the physical, mental and energetic body.
We will also introduce you to the practice of body weight resistance training and its important role in increasing strength and functionality of muscle mass for maintenance of longevity of life.
We move into our advanced abdominal kriya series, detailing the precise technique and preparatory phases required to enter safely and effectively into these practices. Practices include Kapalabhati, Agnisar, Uddiyana kriya, Bhastrika, Nauli and correct application of Bandha.
We will learn the subtle art of transitioning between postures, linking poses, sequencing and forming balanced, safe and invigorating practices for ourselves and students. We explore various class themes and how to break down and prepare the body gradually for advanced postures. Students will explore more advanced asana workshops in this week, including inversions, arm balances, balancing postures, and deeper forward and backbends.
The major theme of this week is Yoga in action, Karma Yoga. Following deep self enquiry, we can begin to look at how our beliefs, views, attitude, decisions, actions and our overall Bhava (way of being) in the moment, governs and transforms our karmic cycles and determines whether we subdue or harden the binds of samsara.
AUTUMN BHAKTI YOGA COURSE
HIGHLIGHTS:
Calming Balancing Pranayama
Restorative Yin Yoga
Combining Yin Yang yoga practice
Yin Yang Theory & Daoism
The Three Pillars of Yin
Interoception & Vagal Toning
Myofascia & meridian theory
Emotions and TCM theory
Bhakti Yoga & Devotional Kirtan
Yin asana alignment & propping
Japa Mantra & sound meditations
Exploration true surrender & Ishvara Pranidhana
Also known as fall, Autumn signals the passing of ripeness and the dropping of fruit. The hard work is complete and we are encouraged to sit back and enjoy the rewards. Yet many of us struggle to let go, to surrender. We move from one achievement to the next, addicted to the busyness of life. Maybe you’re suffering from repeated injuries, fatigue, stress, burnout or insomnia. You can’t seem to get yourself out of the rat race, out of your own incessant activity. This is the season for you.
In the Autumn Bhakti immersion, we start to unwind and shift to the opposite paradigm in the art of surrender. In this busy modern world, such a simple nourishing instinct has been somewhat paralysed in most, with many people moving around in a chronic state of sympathetic overdrive, leading to eventual burnout and a lot of complex stress related metabolic disorders.
This week students will move into the Yin phase of the program where they discover a completely different approach to yoga asana. One that is fully supported, pacifying, yielding, calming and cooling. This week marks the shift and reversal in direction of the consciousness back inward towards its centre. Students will experience how creative and suggestive language, tone, pace of voice and orientation of the teacher can support pratyahara, deeply hypnotic, and restoring states, allowing breath and body to drop back towards its parasympathetic orientation.
We will enter more deeply into the calming, cooling, introverting and balancing pranayama practices to bring about inner relaxation and grounding.
Students will learn about the theory and foundations of Yin Yoga, fascia and the myofascial meridians and how emotions and memories are generated and stored in the body according to traditional chinese medicine.
This is also our week of understanding the theme of Bhakti yoga, because devotion profoundly opens the heart and surrenders the ego to something greater than itself. Through chanting, kirtan and sound healing we further develop our capacity to expand our receptivity and listen more deeply within.

WINTER RAJA YOGA COURSE
HIGHLIGHTS:
Breath elongation & Kumbhaka
Traditional Hatha Practices
Chakra theory & sadhana
Mudra
Dharana meditations
Longer Periods Mindful Silence
Digital Detox
Raja Yoga and Patanjai Sutras
Reflection on Buddhist Philosophy
Silent walking meditation
Winter marks the end of fall. All has released, transformed and dissolved back into the ground, ready to reinvent the wheel. It marks the end of the cycle and a return to deep sleep, restfulness, stillness and inner quietude. Winter is about bringing our physical, mental, emotional and energetic cycles to an end so that a new rebirth can arise. We must allow ourselves to enter into the void so that our entire system can achieve a healthy reboot. We enter winter each night in our few hours of deep sleep; slumbering in emptiness the subtlest sheath of our being.
In our culminating week of Winter Raja, we enter into a silence within ourselves, a state of voidness, quiet presence, exploring meditation and concentration practices that move us through the samyama of Dharana, Dhyana and Samadhi. We will guide the breath and pranayama practices in a manner that will lead to tranquillity, internalisation and one pointedness of mind, through an intuitive quietening and lengthening of exhalation and the approach to effortless breath suspension.
Our morning asana practice will explore a more meditative and stillness approach to asana, reflecting quietly on our energy body as we move through the theme of our chakras and the teachings and practices around chakra awareness and healing. We will also experience the use of Mudras, bodily gestures and the effect they have on our energy system, emotions and the state of our mind.
This week we go deeper into the Yoga Sutras of Sage Patanjali and his eight limbs of practice leading to liberation and reflect on how it can be applied to our everyday lives.
This week will have more time for silent reflection, silent walks, yoga nidra and meditation together.


PROGRAM SCHEDULE:
7 - 8AM
MORNING BREATHWORK AND KRIYAS ACCORDING TO SEASON
8 - 9.30AM
GUIDED GROUP PRACTICE ACCORDING TO SEASON​
9.30 - 10.30AM
LIGHT TEA AND FRUIT BREAKFAST
10.30 - 11.30AM
APPLIED YOGA ANATOMY AND PHYSIOLOGY PRINCIPLES
12 - 1PM
IN DEPTH ASANA WORKSHOPS - ALIGNMENT, TECHNIQUE, PROPPING, MODIFICATIONS, ADJUSTMENTS
1 - 3PM
SATTVIC VEGETARIAN LUNCH
3 - 4.30PM
PHILOSOPHY AND GROUP SHARING AND DISCUSSION
4.30 - 5.30PM
TEACHING THEORY, PRINCIPLES AND METHODOLOGY WORKSHOPS AND MINI TEACHING PRACTICUMS
5.30 - 6.30PM
LIGHT EVENING TEA AND SNACK AND BREAK
7 - 8PM
STUDENTS GROUP SELF READING, STUDY, NOTE TAKING, REFLECTION, DISCUSSION AND INTEGRATION
8 - 9PM
EVENING RESTORATIVES AND RELAXATION, YOGA NIDRA, PRANAYAMA AND MEDITATION PRACTICES
Days 1 – 5 – Full schedule
Day 6 – Reduced schedule
Day 7 – Rest
* Schedule may be subject to some time shifts

PROGRAM ELEMENTS
All of our programs incorporate the following curriculum components:
GUIDED PRACTICE
Experience is the best practice as students get to move through the real time application of yoga techniques and come to know the effect on their own body. Each day we have three sessions dedicated to guiding different components of the practices including breathing and Kriyas, movement based asana practices and meditation, relaxation and devotional practices.
TECHNIQUE AND TRAINING
In these in depth workshops, the skill and techniques in applying certain practices and asana alignment modification, adjustment and propping techniques will be shared with more hands on demonstration and group interaction so that students can learn and assimilate a greater understanding and apply it in their practice.
ANATOMY PHYSIOLOGY THEORY
Each day will contain practical applicable anatomy golden nuggets with the help of pictures, illustrations and demonstrations, to really show students what is under their skin in order to facilitate a greater awareness of what is happening as we move through our practice.
PHILOSOPHY AND THEORIES OF YOGA
These sessions will dive deep into the history and background of Yoga, discuss the meaning of Yoga and delineate essential yogic concepts in the study of Key texts such as the Yoga Sutras of Patanjali and Bhagavad Gita.
TEACHING METHODOLOGY
These workshops will be part theory and part practical and help prepare students to be the best teachers possible and highlight key skills they can develop such as preparing and sequencing classes, voice, language and expression, building rapport and congruence, class set up, moving around the room, demonstration skills, verbal and physical hands on assists, and more.
TEACHING PRACTICUMS
This is the opportunity for students and those serious about teaching to get stuck in an just start trying to teach. We do this from our very first day with non intimidating mini tasks to slowly ease you into the flow of teaching and getting use to being seen and heard and building rapport with students. This is where you can start to play and explore your own unique approach to sharing your practice.
STUDENTS SELF STUDY, REFLECTION AND INTEGRATION
This is a really important time for students to reflect and read up on what has been taught throughout the course and a chance for you to organize your notes, consolidate your understanding and even begin preparing some ideas and practices of your own to share with the group.

eventname: Swami Rama Dhyana Gurukulam - Admissions Open
description:
Swami Rama Dhyana Gurukulam (SRDG) offers study of traditional ancient teachings of the Himalayan tradition that have perpetuated since the Vedic times. The Gurukulam was established in 2003 by Mahamandaleshwar Swami Veda Bharati with the vision of passing on the ancient teachings of the Himalayan Masters in their purest form to the next generation of aspirants.

The Gurukulam, literally, the Guru’s Family envisages personal spiritual experience to be the foundation of all education in every area of learning. As such the program has been developed to train and mentor aspirants so that these teachings would permeate the whole of their lives.

The one-year residential intensive program in the Himalayan Yoga Meditation Tradition will allow a student to systematically learn the spiritual sciences within a practical framework so that these teachings may be useful for them towards self-transformation. The emphasis is on creating a foundation of spiritual values upon which they may build their future in the world.

The ‘One-Year Residential Program in the Himalayan Yoga Meditation Tradition’ will harmoniously hold an integrated study and practice of all the paths of yoga, including bhakti, jnana, karma, and raja yoga. The students will be taught the philosophy, science, and practices of hatha yoga, breathing awareness and pranayamas, subtle body relaxations, and meditation. Ancient scriptures including selected Prakarana Granthas, selected sections of the Shrimad Bhagavad Gita, the Samkhya darshana, and the Yoga Sutras of Patanjali will be taught. All students will also be taught Sanskrit and Vedic Chantings.

The students must commit to a year-long stay at the Swami Rama Sadhaka Grama ashram in Rishikesh, India. The daily schedule of classes, practices, and karma yoga will run from 5 am to 10 pm every day, and all the students will be expected to participate fully in the daily schedule.

Applications are now open for the initial one-year long Gurukulam program that begins on the Vijayadashami (Ashwina Shukla Dashami/Dusshera) 2022, which would be on the October 5th.

Medium of Instruction: English and Hindi
Cost/Fees: A loving and committed heart. Donations/Dakshinas towards one’s stay are welcome.
Eligibility: All seekers, irrespective of religion, gender, caste, etc. who can commit to a year-long stay at the Swami Rama Sadhaka Grama ashram in Rishikesh, India.
Age Limit: 20-30 Years

At this time, we are only able to accept Indian students (including OCI and NRI) due to long-term stay visa restrictions/requirements.

The last date for applying to the course would be the 31st July, 2022. Contact: gurukulam@sadhakagrama.org .

eventname: 11 Day Spiritual \Soul Retrieval\" & Yoga Retreat in Rishikesh"
description:
Summary of the Retreat:

This retreat explores the practices of Shamanic Soul Retrieval, Soul Healing, Mindfulness Practices, Meditation & Relaxation techniques introduced as an essential part of preparing and moving into altered states of consciousness which promotes healing of the Soul.

While Shamanic Soul Retrieval & Soul Healing are the highlight of the retreat, the curriculum also integrates yoga asanas, pranayama, transcendental breathing, emotional healing & relaxation practices on a daily basis to bring balance into the practice and to make a way for the body & mind to go through deeper healing of the soul and soul retrieval, making it easy for the integration process.

The course will explore the concept of Shamanic Soul Retrieval, Shamanic Journeys, SOUL, Sacred Heart of Shaman, Shamanic Archetype, Mental & Emotional Healing along with meditation, breathing, relaxation practices, and yoga at the levels of both theory and practical.

This is designed to assist students of yoga to understand and experience the deeper layers of themselves. Students will be guided through simple practices from beginner to an intermediate level which will allow them to carry on their practice at home to maintain balance in daily life.

Description:

This Retreat is 11 days long. Each day you will be doing 4-5 hours of yoga, pranayama, transcendental breathing, meditation & relaxation practice, and the most important part Shamanic Soul Retrieval, Soul Healing & Emotional Healing.

We will serve you organic vegetarian food, three meals per day in a form of a buffet. Additionally, you will be offered tea or coffee two times a day.

In terms of accommodation, you will have a choice between a private room where you will live by yourself and a shared room where you will live with one or two more members of the retreat. All rooms have an attached bathroom and balcony.

During the retreat, you will be guided by an experienced spiritual teacher and Shaman. We will provide structure and discipline for you to achieve balance in your personal life and bring you closer to your highest potential.

There are two yoga shalas located at the top of the Dewa Retreat. From there you can have a great view of the forest and mountains surrounding the area.

Our space has been designed to align you with the greatest version of self, to respect the environment, and look after all living beings.

During the new moon and full moon, we will be performing Shamanic Ceremonies.

At the end of the retreat, you will not only gain an inner expansion but also a valuable life experience!

For more details and for booking this retreat, go in this link: 

https://bookretreats.com/11-day-spiritual-soul-retrieval-yoga-retreat-in-rishikesh

For more informations contact organizers from this link given above.

Blessings!

eventname: 300 Hours Yoga Teacher Training Course in Rishikesh India
description:
Our new yoga class is starting from 1st July, August & September.

Namaste & Welcome to Yogada Ashram in the Himalayas providing yoga and meditation training to new and experienced yoga teachers in Rishikesh. We are a unique Ashram style Institution with Guru Shishya Parampara (tradition) with ethnically designed Ashram on the Banks of the holy Ganga river in the Himalayas, where we all learn amidst pure nature.
Our Courses

300 Hours Yoga Teachers Training Courses : 33 Days course inclusive of boarding and lodging at Yogada – An Ashram Style Yoga & wellness Retreat in the Himalayas, with intensive training course.   
Our Yoga Teachers Training Course 300 hours, not only give you the firsthand knowledge of the this tradition, but guide you to perfect health & making you fit and in sync with the universe through rare techniques, so that your teachings can carry forward this ancient tradition in its original & purest form. 
Our Teachers Training Courses 300 hours are also unique as we teach and practice the time tested traditional knowledge only, as well as teach the unknown dimensions of yogic science: Practicing the new dimensions of yogic science all our courses start with your Yogic Diagnosis as per the ancient traditional practices, on one to one basis. You will be asked and watched to surface your Doshas (irregularity) through your behavioral and eating habits. Once diagnosed your living throughout the course will be based on your body type giving you a complete practical firsthand Knowledge of changing & rejuvenating yourself, so that you can change others once you become a teacher yourself.

Certification: All the seekers completing the course will be awarded Certificate by a team of rare and highly qualified teachers, scientists, trainers & healers in the entire country with 200 Hours Yoga Teachers Training Certificate from Yogada – in the Himalayas – Certified YTTC 200/ 300 hours School from Yoga Alliance USA .
On the basis of this certificate one can register him/herself with Yoga Alliance USA.

For Course details & availability please email with your month of attending the course.
E Mail — yogadahimalaya@gmail.com & yogada@rishikesh.in

As our beloved Swami Veda Bharati has said, “The most profound teachings of the Tradition are in silence. The greatest growth of the human mind takes place in silence.”

Maunam Guided Silence Retreats

Come experience deeper levels of your inner self through the practice of silence. This six-day retreat, away from the business of daily life, will help you calm down the constant flow of random thoughts and emotions and rejuvenate yourself on all levels. This retreat includes two days of foundations and preparations to silence, three days of silence practice and introspection, as well as one day of sharing and assimilation.

“Silence is such a profound and deep experience of human existence that only when we have understood silence would we understand all the inspiration that has ever flowed to humanity from the minds and mouths of its great saints and sages.” – Swami Veda Bharati

Our new yoga class is starting from 1st july.

Our Yoga Teachers training course 200 hours is very unique as they are conducted amidst pure nature at Himalayan Foothills near the birth place of ancient Indian Science of Yoga. Other than the course, special Emphasis is given to healthy living amidst nature & hygienic & healthy organic food.

Our Yoga Teachers Training Course 200 hours is also unique as we use the most highly qualified teachers in the area, who have been busy in their studies till now and have started reflecting very recently.

Our Yoga Teachers Training Course 200 hours is also unique as we teach and practice the time tested traditional knowledge only, as well as teach the unknown dimensions of yogic science: Practicing the new dimensions of yogic science all our courses start with your Yogic Diagnosis as per the ancient traditional practices, on one to one basis. You will be asked and watched to surface your Doshas (irregularity) through your behavioral and eating habits. Once diagnosed your living throughout the course will be based on your body type giving you a complete practical firsthand Knowledge of changing & rejuvenating yourself, so that you can change others once you become a teacher yourself.

Our Courses

200 Hours Yoga Teachers Training Courses 2022: 24  Days course inclusive of boarding and lodging at Yogada – An Ashram Style Yoga & Wellness Retreat in the Himalayas, on the banks of the holy Ganges.

Certification: All the seekers completing the course will be awarded Certificate by a team of rare and highly qualified teachers, scientists, trainers & healers in the entire country with 200 Hours Yoga Teachers Training Course Certificate from Yogada – in the Himalayas – Certified YTTC 200 hours School from Yoga Alliance USA as well as Yoga Alliance Canada
On the basis of this certificate, one can register him/herself with Yoga Alliance USA.

eventname: YOGA TEACHER TRAINING IN INDIA con traduzione simultanea dall'inglese all'italiano
description:
Desideri diventare un eccellente insegnante di Yoga e di Meditazione?

Vorresti studiare e praticare in India, culla dello Yoga, ma non conosci l'inglese?

Stai cercando un'esperienza intensa e trasformativa?

Allora questo corso fa per te!

DALL' 8 AGOSTO AL 3 SETTEMBRE

La particolarità della traduzione in italiano rende questo percorso formativo davvero unico e d’eccezione.
Molte persone, infatti, desidererebbero approfondire la disciplina dello Yoga e della meditazione avendone esperienza diretta nella loro terra d’origine, ma non conoscono l’inglese. Così, anche persone che insegnano da anni, partecipano al nostro TT  esaudendo il desiderio di fare un’esperienza indiana.

Il percorso formativo è dedicato a tutti coloro che vogliono immergersi in una pratica e in una comprensione profonda di questa disciplina antica e straordinaria , ottenendo un riconoscimento a livello internazionale come insegnante di Yoga (RYT200), ma soprattutto ottenendo per sé stessi un arricchimento nel proprio percorso interiore indipendentemente dalla mansione dell’insegnamento.

La pratica dell’Himalayan Yoga segue la tradizione classica indiana, non è soggetta a marchi registrati, né a reinterpretazioni o rivisitazioni occidentalizzate, essa rappresenta e incarna lo Yoga così com’è.
Pertanto questa formazione di insegnanti di Yoga (Teacher Training) è utile ai praticanti/insegnanti o agli studenti/principianti di qualsiasi declinazione moderna dello Yoga, perché ne possano assaporare l’autenticità ed il senso intimo e profondo, perché possano godere di questo arricchimento anche nella loro pratica quotidiana e perché ne possano integrare i preziosi insegnamenti nella vita di tutti i giorni.
La scuola di formazione si terrà a Rishikesh, ai piedi dell’Himalayan e vicino al sacro fiume Gange, presso l’ Himalayan Yog Ashram fondato dal Maestro Yogi Ram.

CONTATTAMI in privato per avere informazioni

ULTIMI POSTI !!!

eventname: Four Seasons Yoga training retreat season - Rishikesh - India
description:
FOUR SEASONS YOGA TEACHER TRAINING & YOGA COURSES.

A UNIQUE MULTI-MODAL APPROACH TO LEARNING YOGA 
OVER 4 UNIQUE WEEKS 

RISHIKESH INDIA
24th SEPT - 22nd OCT 2022
With Dr Yamuna (Yan), Amit Mishra, & Guest teachers

www.fourseasonsyoga.org

A little bird tweeted this...

We have 4 UNIQUE WEEKS weaving together 4 distinct approaches to yoga giving students a balanced breadth of knowledge and experience. 

Our Weeklong seasons include: 

- Spring Jnana - Gentle therapeutic somatic, enquiring
- Summer Karma - strengthening vinyasa & ashtanga, advanced kriya
- Autumn Bhakti -Yin restorative-cooling pranayama-Surrender-Bhakti
- Winter Raja - Meditation, Chakra sadhana, Hatha meditative asana-Shoonya

Much more info is on our website here: https://fourseasonsyoga.org/yoga-training/

SPECIAL FIRST GRABS OFFER:

4 amazing HALF PRICE discounts for the first 4 TTC students only by replying to this post or messaging us on a first come first serve basis! It's not on our website... 1 spot has already been grabbed.

We also have great early bird offers to take advantage of... 30% off BEFORE THE 24TH JUNE... that's just a week away! see our prices here: https://fourseasonsyoga.org/pricing/

Feel free to message and find out more from us. 

For more info or to grab the first spots before they run out, just message us on Fb or whatsap +447966279947 or head to our Registration form:

https://fourseasonsyoga.org/registration/

More about us here!
https://fourseasonsyoga.org/about-us/
With love xXx

>>>>>>>>>>>>

Join us this September in Rishikesh India for 4 unique weeks of yoga practice and training together. You can join us for the whole month or for individual weeks.

Our yoga training programs are open to all, whether you are simply looking to gain knowledge to deepen your own personal yoga practice or gain experience to start sharing Yoga with others. If you are seeking to teach in future, it is suggested to have at least two years of consistent personal yoga practice before sharing with others professionally.

only 10 spots available and we have some amazing first grab and early bird offers.

more info at:
www.fourseasonsyoga.org

Our Yoga retreat season dates!
200hr Four Seasons Teacher Training
– 24 sept – 22nd oct –

– Spring Jnana course– 24 sept- 1 oct
– Summer Karma course – 1 – 8 oct
– Autumn Bhakti course – 8 – 15 oct
– Winter Raja course – 15 – 22 oct

ABOUT OUR UNIQUE YOGA SEASONS...

SPRING JNANA YOGA COURSE
HIGHLIGHTS:

Radical breath recovery series
Gentle Kriyas
Somatic & Therapeutic Yoga practice
Yoga alignment workshops
Self massage, diaphragm & psoas release techniques
Trauma healing & the nervous system
Anatomy of the breath
Jnana Yoga & the 5 Sheaths Kosha
Dynamic meditations
Yoga Nidra

Exactly as the name implies, spring is all about ‘springing’ back to life. The season runs from complete inertia to gradual bloom. The quality of energy is rising, reaching, expanding and flowering, becoming more colorful. It’s about coming out of our dormant form and slowly learning how to express ourselves again. This week teaches us how to be gentle with ourselves, to move slow, to cultivate greater awareness as we integrate into our bodies after a long period of rest, sedentary lifestyle or perhaps even injury.

In the Spring Jnana immersion, the focus and learning outcomes will be centered around super gentle, therapeutic and somatic forms of yoga and kriya practices. Practical sessions will explore the effects of ultra slow movement, shaking and releasing, Zero resistance movements, upa yoga preparations, isolated joint rotations, gentle mobilisation practices and propped and supported asanas allowing us to re-engage our bodies.

We will learn about the nervous system, interoception and the experience of the somatic body, along with somatic trauma healing techniques and how the principles of tracking, resourcing, pendulating, and grounding can be applied in our yoga practice.

Our radical breath recovery series will show you the power of simple breath techniques for recovering the function of the diaphragm, pelvic floor and abdominal muscles. We will have you understand the complex anatomy of the breath and body so that you have an awareness of the implication and effect of certain practices and postures.

We will detail the alignment and technique to be applied in each yoga posture and to see when and how to make adjustments and prop to gain maximum benefit of each asana.
We will introduce the philosophy and history of yoga and align you to its original meaning and purpose so that you can move forth with the correct outlook and intention.

The major theme of the week is self enquiry and re-integrating a deep awareness of everything that makes us human, our body, breath, emotions, mind, intellect, bliss nature and beyond all these sheaths, our eternal self. This season is about reintegration of all our parts.


SUMMER KARMA YOGA COURSE
HIGHLIGHTS:

Advanced abdominal Kriya series
Heating Vinyasa & Ashtanga Yoga
Bodyweight resistance training
How to be strong yet at ease
Vinyasa & Tristana theory
Correct Bandha technique
Yoga Sequencing workshops
Karma yoga
Musculoskeletal Anatomy
Advanced asana workshops
Evening cooling pranayama
Tranquilizing meditation practices

Summer is about being in full swing. You’ve broken out of your shell and you’re exploring what it feels like to shine and enjoy a good challenge. This season is about being at your peak and perhaps even challenging your limit for further expansion. Your body and energy are in good health and together we learn how to stay balanced, at ease and free from injury and burnout by understanding the stress - rest - regenerate cycle and how to move with ease and grace through practice and life challenges.

In the summer Karma immersions, we will move the group towards more heat generating practices with larger compound movements and greater emphasis on sun salutation and strengthening vinyasa practices, guiding students to align their movement with a clear awareness of the breath and its importance in practice, giving them insight into the need for breath moderation in order to understand that breath maintenance is central to maintaining steadiness and ease in the physical, mental and energetic body. 

We will also introduce you to the practice of body weight resistance training and its important role in increasing strength and functionality of muscle mass for maintenance of longevity of life.

We move into our advanced abdominal kriya series, detailing the precise technique and preparatory phases required to enter safely and effectively into these practices. Practices include Kapalabhati, Agnisar, Uddiyana kriya, Bhastrika, Nauli and correct application of Bandha.

We will learn the subtle art of transitioning between postures, linking poses, sequencing and forming balanced, safe and invigorating practices for ourselves and students. We explore various class themes and how to break down and prepare the body gradually for advanced postures. Students will explore more advanced asana workshops in this week, including inversions, arm balances, balancing postures, and deeper forward and backbends.

The major theme of this week is Yoga in action, Karma Yoga. Following deep self enquiry, we can begin to look at how our beliefs, views, attitude, decisions, actions and our overall Bhava (way of being) in the moment, governs and transforms our karmic cycles and determines whether we subdue or harden the binds of samsara.

AUTUMN BHAKTI YOGA COURSE
HIGHLIGHTS:

Calming Balancing Pranayama
Restorative Yin Yoga
Combining Yin Yang yoga practice
Yin Yang Theory & Daoism
The Three Pillars of Yin
Interoception & Vagal Toning
Myofascia & meridian theory
Emotions and TCM theory
Bhakti Yoga & Devotional Kirtan
Yin asana alignment & propping
Japa Mantra & sound meditations
Exploration true surrender & Ishvara Pranidhana

Also known as fall, Autumn signals the passing of ripeness and the dropping of fruit. The hard work is complete and we are encouraged to sit back and enjoy the rewards. Yet many of us struggle to let go, to surrender. We move from one achievement to the next, addicted to the busyness of life. Maybe you’re suffering from repeated injuries, fatigue, stress, burnout or insomnia. You can’t seem to get yourself out of the rat race, out of your own incessant activity. This is the season for you.

In the Autumn Bhakti immersion, we start to unwind and shift to the opposite paradigm in the art of surrender. In this busy modern world, such a simple nourishing instinct has been somewhat paralysed in most, with many people moving around in a chronic state of sympathetic overdrive, leading to eventual burnout and a lot of complex stress related metabolic disorders.
This week students will move into the Yin phase of the program where they discover a completely different approach to yoga asana. One that is fully supported, pacifying, yielding, calming and cooling. This week marks the shift and reversal in direction of the consciousness back inward towards its centre. Students will experience how creative and suggestive language, tone, pace of voice and orientation of the teacher can support pratyahara, deeply hypnotic, and restoring states, allowing breath and body to drop back towards its parasympathetic orientation.

We will enter more deeply into the calming, cooling, introverting and balancing pranayama practices to bring about inner relaxation and grounding.
Students will learn about the theory and foundations of Yin Yoga, fascia and the myofascial meridians and how emotions and memories are generated and stored in the body according to traditional chinese medicine.

This is also our week of understanding the theme of Bhakti yoga, because devotion profoundly opens the heart and surrenders the ego to something greater than itself. Through chanting, kirtan and sound healing we further develop our capacity to expand our receptivity and listen more deeply within.


WINTER RAJA YOGA COURSE
HIGHLIGHTS:

Breath elongation & Kumbhaka
Traditional Hatha Practices
Chakra theory & sadhana
Mudra
Dharana meditations
Longer Periods Mindful Silence
Digital Detox
Raja Yoga and Patanjai Sutras
Reflection on Buddhist Philosophy
Silent walking meditation

Winter marks the end of fall. All has released, transformed and dissolved back into the ground, ready to reinvent the wheel. It marks the end of the cycle and a return to deep sleep, restfulness, stillness and inner quietude. Winter is about bringing our physical, mental, emotional and energetic cycles to an end so that a new rebirth can arise. We must allow ourselves to enter into the void so that our entire system can achieve a healthy reboot. We enter winter each night in our few hours of deep sleep; slumbering in emptiness the subtlest sheath of our being.

In our culminating week of Winter Raja, we enter into a silence within ourselves, a state of voidness, quiet presence, exploring meditation and concentration practices that move us through the samyama of Dharana, Dhyana and Samadhi. We will guide the breath and pranayama practices in a manner that will lead to tranquillity, internalisation and one pointedness of mind, through an intuitive quietening and lengthening of exhalation and the approach to effortless breath suspension.

Our morning asana practice will explore a more meditative and stillness approach to asana, reflecting quietly on our energy body as we move through the theme of our chakras and the teachings and practices around chakra awareness and healing. We will also experience the use of Mudras, bodily gestures and the effect they have on our energy system, emotions and the state of our mind.
This week we go deeper into the Yoga Sutras of Sage Patanjali and his eight limbs of practice leading to liberation and reflect on how it can be applied to our everyday lives.

This week will have more time for silent reflection, silent walks, yoga nidra and meditation together.



PROGRAM SCHEDULE:

7 - 8AM
MORNING BREATHWORK AND KRIYAS ACCORDING TO SEASON
8 - 9.30AM
GUIDED GROUP PRACTICE ACCORDING TO SEASON​
9.30 - 10.30AM
LIGHT TEA AND FRUIT BREAKFAST
10.30 - 11.30AM
APPLIED YOGA ANATOMY AND PHYSIOLOGY PRINCIPLES
12 - 1PM
IN DEPTH ASANA WORKSHOPS - ALIGNMENT, TECHNIQUE, PROPPING, MODIFICATIONS, ADJUSTMENTS
1 - 3PM
SATTVIC VEGETARIAN LUNCH
3 - 4.30PM
PHILOSOPHY AND GROUP SHARING AND DISCUSSION
4.30 - 5.30PM
TEACHING THEORY, PRINCIPLES AND METHODOLOGY WORKSHOPS AND MINI TEACHING PRACTICUMS
5.30 - 6.30PM
LIGHT EVENING TEA AND SNACK AND BREAK
7 - 8PM
STUDENTS GROUP SELF READING, STUDY, NOTE TAKING, REFLECTION, DISCUSSION AND INTEGRATION
8 - 9PM
EVENING RESTORATIVES AND RELAXATION, YOGA NIDRA, PRANAYAMA AND MEDITATION PRACTICES

Days 1 – 5 – Full schedule
Day 6 – Reduced schedule
Day 7 – Rest
* Schedule may be subject to some time shifts


PROGRAM ELEMENTS

All of our programs incorporate the following curriculum components:

GUIDED PRACTICE
Experience is the best practice as students get to move through the real time application of yoga techniques and come to know the effect on their own body. Each day we have three sessions dedicated to guiding different components of the practices including breathing and Kriyas, movement based asana practices and meditation, relaxation and devotional practices.

TECHNIQUE AND TRAINING
In these in depth workshops, the skill and techniques in applying certain practices and asana alignment modification, adjustment and propping techniques will be shared with more hands on demonstration and group interaction so that students can learn and assimilate a greater understanding and apply it in their practice.

ANATOMY PHYSIOLOGY THEORY
Each day will contain practical applicable anatomy golden nuggets with the help of pictures, illustrations and demonstrations, to really show students what is under their skin in order to facilitate a greater awareness of what is happening as we move through our practice.

PHILOSOPHY AND THEORIES OF YOGA
These sessions will dive deep into the history and background of Yoga, discuss the meaning of Yoga and delineate essential yogic concepts in the study of Key texts such as the Yoga Sutras of Patanjali and Bhagavad Gita.

TEACHING METHODOLOGY
These workshops will be part theory and part practical and help prepare students to be the best teachers possible and highlight key skills they can develop such as preparing and sequencing classes, voice, language and expression, building rapport and congruence, class set up, moving around the room, demonstration skills, verbal and physical hands on assists, and more.

TEACHING PRACTICUMS
This is the opportunity for students and those serious about teaching to get stuck in an just start trying to teach. We do this from our very first day with non intimidating mini tasks to slowly ease you into the flow of teaching and getting use to being seen and heard and building rapport with students. This is where you can start to play and explore your own unique approach to sharing your practice.

STUDENTS SELF STUDY, REFLECTION AND INTEGRATION
This is a really important time for students to reflect and read up on what has been taught throughout the course and a chance for you to organize your notes, consolidate your understanding and even begin preparing some ideas and practices of your own to share with the group.

eventname: 100 Hours Yoga Course in Rishikesh India
description:
99 hours Yoga course in Rishikesh: Maha Manthan – Churn thy Self deep with initiation to Sattya Yoga and churn yourself deep to make you evolve to a deeper heights and transforming yourself to an all new of you.. …….. Ready to be guided by the universe to take you as per your cosmic plans………

Yoga is a science to make yourself in line with the cosmic geometry and elevating yourself to the higher level of existence for complete transformation and visualising, creating and reaching your destiny.

Come and explore yourself with the time tested knowledge of wisdom – the YOGa, with Sattya Yoga, making your Yoga foundation stronger and letting you initiate the direction of the path you may opt for rest of the life.

                                          2022 Yoga Course Level 3 : 99 Hours: Maha Manthan
Manthan (Churning thy Self) 99 hours – Churn yourself with the rare traditional knowledge practiced by the Yogis in these part of the Himalayas from time immoral, to address the deeper meanings of life. 9 nights & 10 Days specially designed program, right at the birth place of yoga, to uplift yourself to new heights to be in pure bliss, experiencing an all new dimension in life.
Activities : 2022 Yoga Course 66 hours Package
          Initiation to Sattya Yoga with Shakipad at the beginning, Mid & end of the course. Total 3
          Daily Early morning nature walks in the reserve forests and crystal clear sand beaches (60 Minutes)
          Daily Early morning Cleansing Sessions (30 Minutes )
          Daily morning class (90 minutes each) of covering physical dimensions of yoga with Asanas.
          Daily One Class of Yoga Philosophy / Mythology exploring the roots of Yoga to make your foundations of Yoga deeper and stronger (60 minutes) .
          Daily Afternoon Class (90 minutes each ) of covering different dimensions of Asanas.
          Daily evening class (60 minutes) covering Pranayama, Kriya, & Dhayna (Mediation) with special transformational and awareness sessions
            with emphasis on Kundalini Shakti.
            Daily Bhakti Yoga – Evening Chanting sessions .
            Daily Karma Yoga sessions in the morning & evening.
            Daily Japa Yoga – Beej Mantra repeating Sessions in the evening.
         

Ayurveda:
          Daily one Ayurveda treatment & Massages. (total 6. 33 minutes x2 = 66 Minutes daily )

Certification of Yogada – An internationally recognised Yoga School by Yoga Alliance USA
                       Certificate for Yoga Course 100 hours

Limited seats in all batches from 9 students to maximum 16 students in one batch.

योग और प्राणायाम प्राचीन काल से भारतीय अध्यात्मिक संरचना का केन्द्र रहा है । इसके आदिम सूत्रधार परमयोगी शिव ही हैं। कठोपनिषद के अनुसार जब इन्द्रियां मन के साथ और मन अधिनस्थ बुद्धि के साथ स्थिर हो जाता है तो वह अवस्था  योग की होती है ।श्री गीता के अनुसार कोई भी मनुष्य एकाग्रचित्त होकर निष्काम भाव से कर्म करते हुवे योग को सिद्ध कर सकता है।‌योगी और ऋषियों के अनुसार यह ,नियम,आसन, ध्यान,धारणा आदि आठ अंगों से संपन्न प्राणायाम की विविध क्रियाएं योग कहलाती हैं। इससे चित्त की एकाग्रता बढ़ती है, बुद्धि में स्थिरता आती हैं, चिन्तन उत्कृष्ट होता है,मन में सदविचार का उदय होता है। नाकारात्मक प्रवृत्तियां स्वत: समाज हो जाती है।
परिणामत: आत्मिक और शारीरिक शक्तियों में वृद्धि होती है। इसलिए इसे समस्त संसार ने आत्मसात किया है।

In order to maintain our Leadership on Telco’s events in India, Nexgen Conferences proud to announce India’s EXCLUSIVE event on Network Automation for Telecom Industry as NETWORK AUTOMATION CONGRESS 2022, schedule to be held on 24th June 2022 at Hotel Taj Lands End – Mumbai.

In the era of digital transformation, automation is everything. The technology building blocks of a digital organization, such as Internet of Things, cloud computing, and mobility, are all reliant on the network. If the network is slow, it will stall your digital transformation, but intelligent network automation will propel you forward and help you thrive. Network automation is the process to plan, deploy, configure, orchestrate and assure networks and services using software. Network automation is increasingly required to manage the complexities of modern, dynamic networks and to orchestrate services in an efficient and effective manner.

The end goal of network automation is to create”zero-touch” or autonomous networks. In the interim implementation of automation in 5G networks addresses three key operational issues facing telecom operators today.

Reduction of human errors in network management and operations
Reduction of service provisioning time and improve time-to-cash
Reduction in time-to-resolve network and security issues through closed-loop network assurance
Currently Telecom Operators networks are becoming dynamic and heterogeneous. The requirement to constantly change network parameters and configurations to meet customer expectations creates huge amounts of complexity. The flexibility of 5G networks makes efficient network operation without high levels of automation impractical. Automation improves every aspect of service provider operations.

If Telecom Operators want to unlock the full potential of future 5G networks, they need automation. Automation reduces error in network operations and service management and accelerates tasks.

At this event – We take this opportunity to invite all stakeholders to come forward and participate at this event to understand the collective needs of Network Automation for Telecom Operators. The event is committed to provide complete 360 degree view of Network Automation progress in India.

This platform will bring together industry top executives to discuss and deliberate on Network Automation.

eventname: Free 1-Day Meditation Training Program-South Bangalore KA
description:
Free Weekend 1-2 Day Class. Apply Here: https://forms.gle/u3dRzim4fje2ru4F9

This training program provides an introduction to Pranahuti Supported Meditation (PSM). This spiritual practice brings balanced living. It enables one to realize one’s inner potential. Pranahuti (Yogic Transmission) by a competent trainer helps one transform and grow in consciousness in a practical manner.
This workshop contains 2-4 experiential guided meditations, and covers the topics of methods of meditation, holistic way of living, control of mind and concentration, Yogic transmission (Pranahuti), and stages of progress.

* Cost for this class and all future support is free.

I am pleased to communicate with you that after a successful maiden edition in 2019, 2nd EXPO PAINT & COATINGS-2022 Exhibition is scheduled to be held at Pragati Maidan, New Delhi from 28th to 30th July 2022.
EXPO PAINT & COATINGS-2022 is an emerging marketplace providing platform to the needs of every facade of Paint & Coating industry right from raw materials, formulation, application, technology, finishing, quality assurance, recycling and disposal. The Exhibition will feature a wide range display of products, Raw Materials, Products, Machines, Equipment & Tools, Current trends, development & innovations shaping future of coating industry.
EXPO PAINT & COATINGS-2022 is the only comprehensive Exhibition on the coating industry in North India, bringing together local and international Manufacturers, Formulators, Importers, Suppliers, Solution providers, Buyers from the Paint & Coatings industry offering its participants unrivalled opportunities to network, exchange best practices, do business, unveil new products and source cutting-edge products, technologies and solutions.

eventname: Untitled - The Narrations of an ordeal
description:
UNTITLED - The Narrations of an ordeal
Complete Immersive Sensory Experience
Not for the faint-hearted
*Trigger Warning - Stories of Sexual assault*
A complete immersive sensory experience performance art piece produced by Rangaai Theatre company, designed and directed by Tushar T. Dalvi. He is also known for his critically acclaimed play The Darkroom 2.0 - An immersive sensory experience show, which has done the most number of shows in intimate independent theatre category and has also been rated 4 stars by Times of India. Rangaai Theatre company is the only immersive sensory experience theatre company in Mumbai. 

UNTITLED is a narration of true stories and a presentation of the shocking reality of society. The piece intends on showing an audience member the terrifying ordeal that rape victims are put through by gruesome acts of the administration, political system as well as their communities. It raises questions on the normalization of a rape culture and the social stigma that is attached to it.

You will be made to experience the horror of the power play, that rape perpetrates, by being thrown into the same situations as those victimized. You will not just be watching the play but living it through performance. This will be achieved by intruding into one's private space and taking control of their experiences by delivering emotions such as disgust, anguish, and guilt. All of this in a hope that you are outraged enough to channelize that rage into some tangible results helping overcome the rape crisis that our country is facing.

Through this performance art piece, we aim to educate, encourage and sensitize our audiences towards this growing issue. We'll also guide you to form and join a league of changemakers by involving a forum platform to ideate, share skills and knowledge to collaborate for a change.

The performance piece will compromise 4 true stories where the audience will play the role of bystanders to the incidents. It will be executed in an immersive sensory experience format, which means, you will have to trust our expertise and surrender to the art. We may put you into uncomfortable positions and scenarios which have intricately been designed to elevate your experience.


Stories: 
The Rape - Franca Rame (Italian Dramatist) 
Janzir
The Bus
Bhediya 

#handstied #blindfoldedentry #immersive #sensoryexperience #rapecrisis #intimatetheatre #performanceart #experimentaltheatre #gudiya #arunaramchandrashanbaug #rape #powerplay #socialstigma #darksociety #zipties #mixmediaperformance 

Disclaimer: The audience members hands will be tied through the performance and a face mask will be covering their vision for a part of the performance. 
The performance contains graphic description and depiction of sexual abuse which some people may find disturbing. Viewers discretion is advised.
Only for a mature audience (18+ yrs only).

eventname: The Darkroom 3.0 - An Immersive Sensory Theatre Experience
description:
Rangaai Theatre Company invites you to this thrilling journey of exploration of 3 classical stories being unfolded in the unique experiential way in front of you. Where the thrill of uncertainty and unknowing is implicated by the blindfolds. Upon arrival, while you are still kept blindfolded you are greeted with characters from story whispering in your ears. It is said a scent can bring back some memories and so we expose you with some scents distinctively from each story. You are also given the power to decide the faith of the characters from the story. Whereas at times they themselves invite you to their stories. They become your friends and share some jokes and stories with you. And finally, they mix so well with you that the line between the actor and the character is blurred and you are transferred to a virtual reality.

All this, to only create a unique experience for you where they strive to make it worth every penny for the audience.

So, if you are as ready to experience Dark and Immersive Theatre for stories as woeful and the world shuffled upside down for stepping into a postmodernist journey of expressions and reactions then, Rangaai Theatre Company invites you to The Darkroom 2.0!

Stories:
Durga Poojo (A True Story) - Anonymous (Trigger Warning) 
Kafan (1936) - Munshi Premchand
Khol Do (1952) - Saadat Hasan Manto.


Note:
Guests have to arrive 20 minutes before the show time
It is going to be an immersive theatre experience where they may take you through different spaces and different stories, so seats are optional and they would suggest guests are mentally prepared to stand through most of the event or offer the seat to those who need it most
The performance intends to evoke emotions such as fear and also make audiences uncomfortable so as to feel the empathy towards the protagonist
Finally the most important rule come with an open mind to enjoy the thrill ride through some classic stories presented with an immersive experience.

eventname: Lazy is new smart : Let IoT handle it
description:
Imagine spending the day relaxing while still accomplishing your tasks. This might seem like daydreaming rather than reality. Isn't it amazing that you can now watch movies and even join meetings online, as well as change the lights based on your mood because of the internet? It wouldn't have made sense a few years ago, but today, it's the norm with help of IoT.
IoT makes virtually everything “smart,” by improving aspects of our life with the power of data collection, AI algorithms, and networks. The goal of IoT is to extend internet connectivity to \dumb\" devices like toasters and turn them into \"smart\" devices. Such devices are basically lazy as a standard device needs to be switched on but as Frank B. Gilbreth Sr once said
banner_url: “I will always choose a lazy person to do a difficult job because a lazy person will find an easy way to do it.” We now have smart kitchen
score: smart vacuums and etc.

eventname: Indian Pride Festival | Jashn - E - Karwaan
description:
June – the Pride Month brings along many such news of the LGBTQIA+ community coming together and celebrating their identity, being themselves and the feeling of being proud of who we are! 

One such never-before kind of celebration is “The Indian Pride Festival”, organized by Gandhinagar Queer Pride Foundation (GQPF). 

To be organized in Ahmedabad but for performers and guests from all over the country, The Indian Pride Festival – Jashn-E-Karwaan celebrates the history of the queer movement in India with a promise to create a better future for the LGBTQIA+ community in future. 

An evening of cultural fest conceptualized, planned, performed and entirely managed by the LGBTQIA+ community of the GQPF family.
Indian Pride Festival is the first all India pride celebration on this particular theme where diverse eminent artists from all over the country would take the opportunity to entertain you and make your evening super special.

description:
ABOUT US:
Astrooworld® – India’s  Biggest Spiritual, Holistic & Wellness Exhibition is country’s largest and most respected Spiritual, holistic healing and wellness, new thought, conscious living event of it’s kind. It has been successfully operating past more than 12 years now and has grown significantly over the years. It’s a 2 days event  for all ages, bringing together one hundred plus different exhibitors and full days of free holistic workshops and seminars for awareness. We have an excellent selection of local, national and international exhibitors, and our ever popular series of free, inspiring workshops. 
Astrooworld® - Body Mind Soul Expo promises you an engaging and inspirational experience, with something for everyone. Whether you’re seeking information, inspiration, inner peace, mental stimulation, or you’re just curious about what’s out there, we invite you to revitalize your body, stimulate your mind, and pamper your soul, bringing you the latest health and holistic information for a Healthier Lifestyle. We promise reasonable prices at all our expos and will always strive to provide the most vibrant and enjoyable experience possible for everyone visiting our show each time.

eventname: Conference on Building Social Entrepreneurial Ecosystem for a More Sustainable and Resilient society
description:
Conference Note:
The Prime Minister of India has declared the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' a nationwide celebration to honour India's 75th anniversary of Independence. The program is a 75-week countdown to India's 75th Independence Day, from March 12, 2021. To mark this occasion, GNLU is proposing an International Conference on \Building Social Entrepreneurial Ecosystem for a More Sustainable and Resilient Society\" – that aims to highlight the contribution of Social Entrepreneurship towards Sustainable Development while also highlighting its role and resilience in these trying times.

event_id: Main sub-themes of the Conference: Topics of interest for submission include
3.	Mapping Social Entrepreneurship Ecosystem and Business Models
4.	Social Entrepreneurship Education & Capacity Building at Higher Education Institutions
5.	The Role of Universities and Incubators to Promote and Support Social Entrepreneurship
6.	Science & Technology Entrepreneurship and Entrepreneurship Policy
7.	Striking Balance between Social Value Creation
10.	Building and strengthening the Social Entrepreneurial ecosystem to face uncertainties
11.	COVID-19 and the next normal for social enterprises in India and across the world
12.	Social Entrepreneurial Response to Pandemic (COVID-19) and Entrepreneurship in Disadvantaged Communities
13.	Self-reliance through Atmanirbhar Bharat Initiative Making Indian SMEs Globally competitive
14.	The paradigm shift of curriculum design for institution integration to boost Atmanirbhar Bharat in light of NEP-2020
The above list is indicative. Papers on any other sub-theme consistent with the central theme may also be considered.
1.	Best Paper Award for each track
2.	Opportunities to Publish in Edited Book (s) with ISBN NO.
3.	Opportunities to interact with social entrepreneurship Ecosystem enablers
Last dates for submission of abstract	June 15
Notification of acceptance/Rejection of abstract	June 20
Last date for submission of the full paper along with the registration fee	July 10
Guidelines and Links for Abstract and Paper Submission: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dxKune7-1I2zJHi5jB0Y6oDJiawUvdcd/view?usp=sharing

Accommodation: Accommodation will be provided only to the first 50 outstation registered paper presenters in University Hostels/nearby institution hostels on sharing basis with limited facilities on 29 & 30 July 2022.

eventname: For further details please visit the website https://gnlu.ac.in/GNLU/News

https://aakarvisitors.com/registration/abse2022

-અષાઢી બીજે જગતના નાથ જગન્નાથની નગરચર્યાની ૧૪૪ વર્ષની ઈતિહાસયાત્રા
-દર વર્ષની જેમ આ ‌વખતે પણ જગન્નાથની ભવ્યાતિભવ્ય રથયાત્રા નીકળશે અષાઢ ને કારણે વધુ લોકો જોડાશે. (દિલિપદાસજી મહારાજ, જગન્નાથ મંદિરના મહંત )
-આઝાદીના સમય પહેલા જ્યારે ભગવાન જગન્નાથની રથયાત્રા નીકળે ત્યારે શહેરીજનો તિરંગો ફરકાવતા હતા.
-બળદગાડાથી શરૂ થયેલી રથયાત્રા હાઇટેક બની, પ્રારંભથી જ ખલાસ કોમના ભાઈઓ રથ ખેંચતા આવ્યા

૧૮૭૬ માં મહામંડળેશ્વર નૃસિંહદાસજીએ સ્વપ્નમાં સ્વયં ભગવાને આપેલા આદેશને માથે ચડાવીને રથયાત્રાનો પ્રારંભ કરાવ્યો હતો એ પછી દર વર્ષે અષાઢી બીજે અમદાવાદમાં જગન્નાથ ભગવાનની રથયાત્રા યોજાતી રહી છે, આટલા વર્ષો પછી આજેય રથયાત્રામાં ભક્તિ અને શ્રદ્ધાનું ઘોડાપૂર યથાવત રહ્યું છે. દરેક ધર્મના લોકો ભક્તિભાવપૂર્વક અને રંગેચંગે ભગવાનને આવકારતા રહ્યા છે. વર્ષમાં માત્ર આ એક દિવસે ભક્તોને દર્શન આપવા માટે ભગવાન સામે ચાલીને આવે છે. ૧૪૩ વર્ષથી ચાલી આવતી આ પરપંરાના અતિતનીઝાંખી કરાવતો આ વિશેષ અહેવાલ...
 
અમદાવાદ : લગભગ ચારસો વર્ષ પહેલાં રામાનંદી સંત શ્રી હનુમાનજીદાસજીએ આજના જગન્નાથજીના મંદિરમાં પોતાની ગાદીની સ્થાપના કરી હતી. એમના પછી ગાદીએ આવેલા સારંગદાસજીએ જગન્નાથજી, બળદેવજી અને દેવી સુભદ્રાજીની મૂર્તિઓ મંગાવીને સ્થાપના કરાવી ત્યારથી જ આ મંદિર ‘જગન્નાથજીની મંદિર’ તરીકે જગપ્રસિદ્ધ થયું. એમના પછી બાલમુકુંદદાસજી આવ્યા અને તે પછી
નરસિંહદાસજી આવ્યા.નરસિંહદાસજીને સ્વપ્નમાં ભગવાન જગન્નાથજી આવ્યા અને તેમણે રથયાત્રા શરૂ કરી. લોકવાયકાઓ અનુસાર  ભરૂચમાં રહેતા ખલાસ કોમના ભક્તોએ પણ રથયાત્રાની પોતાની જવાબદારી સ્વીકારી લીધી. તેમણે તાબડતોબ નરિયેળના ઝાડમાંથી ત્રણે ભગવાનના રથ તૈયાર કરીને અમદાવાદ પહોંચાડી દીધા.

આમ ૧૮૭૬ થી શરૂ થયેલી રથયાત્રામાં પરંપરા મુજબ રથ ખેંચવાનું કાર્ય ખલાસ કોમના ભાઇઓ સાચી શ્રદ્ધાથી દર વર્ષે કરે છે. ૧૪૪ વર્ષ પહેલા શરૂ થયેલી રથયાત્રામાંઉત્તરોત્તર મોટી થતી ગઇ.  શરૂઆતમાં માત્ર સાધુ-સંતો જ રથયાત્રામાં ભાગ લેતા હતા અને તેમનું રસોડું સરસપુરના રણછોડજી મંદિરમાં રાખવામાં આવતું, ભક્તજનોની ભીડ વધતા  સરસપુરમાં ઠેર ઠેર રસોડાંઓ ઊભાં કરવામાં આવ્યાં. દર વર્ષે મામેરું પણ અહીંયા જ કરાય છે નરસિંહદાસજી મહારાજે પ્રથમવાર કાઢેલી રથયાત્રા વખતે ભગવાનને બળદગાડામાં બિરાજમાન કરવામાં આવ્યા હતાં. ત્યારથી લઇને આજ સુધીમાં રથયાત્રા ઐતિહાસીકથી મોર્ડન બની ગઇ છે.

માત્ર રથયાત્રા જ નહી પણ જે રથમાં ભગવાનબિરાજીને નગરચર્યાએ નીકળે છે તેણે પણ હવે નવા રૂપરંગ હાંસલ કરી લીધા છે. રથ નવા રૂપ રંગ ધારણ કર્યા છે સાથોસાથ તેમાં મોર્ડન પૈડા અને સ્ટીંયરીંગ પણ લગાડવામાં આવે છે. શરૂઆતની  યાત્રામાં ગણ્યાગાંઠ્યા પોલિસ કર્મીઓ હતા હવે રથયાત્રામાં શ્રદ્ધાળુઓ કરતા પોલીસ વધારે હોય તેવી લોકોમાં ચર્ચા હોય છે. સહજતાથી ભગવાનની સમીપ જતો ભક્ત હવે રથની નજીક જતા પણ બીતો થઇ ગયો છે.
 
ગાડાથી ટ્રક સુધી:  અત્યારની રથયાત્રા હાઇટેક બની ગઈ છે જ્યારે ૧૯૫૨ ની રથયાત્રાની આ તસવીર રસપ્રદ છે, એ વખતે બળદો દ્વારા યાત્રાના વાહનો ખેંચવામાં આવતા હતા.
રથયાત્રામાં સાહસિક કરતબો કરતા પહેલવાનો આકર્ષણનું કેન્દ્ર હોય છે.
 
૨૦૦૫ માં રથયાત્રા દરમિયાન ક્રાઇમ બ્રાંચના જાંબાઝ અધિકારીઓએ ચાલુ યાત્રાએ સફળ ઓપરેશન કરીને અતિ સંવેદનશીલ એવા શાહપુર વિસ્તારના શાહપુર અડ્ડા પાસેથી ઘાતક હથીયારોનો જંગી જથ્થો પકડી પાડતા મોટી ઘાત ટાળી શકાઈ હતી.
અત્યાર સુધી સૌથી વધુ ૧૨ વખત પહિંદ વિધિ કરવાનો નરેન્દ્ર મોદીનો વિક્રમ
 
ભગવાન જગનાથની જ્યારે નગર ચર્યા માટે નીકળે ત્યારે રાજા તેમનો રસ્તો સાફ કરવા માટે આવે છે તેવી લોકવાયકા અને પરંપરા પુરીમાં ચાલે છે. આથી અમદાવાદની રથયાત્રામાં પણ આ પહિંદ વિધિ યોજવામાં આવે છે. જેમાં રાજ્યના મુખ્યમંત્રી સોનાની સાવરણી લઇને ભગવાનનો રસ્તો સાફ કરે છે. સૌથી વધુ વખત પહિંદ વિધિ કરવાનો રેકોર્ડ હાલમાં દેશના વડાપ્રધાન બનેલા નરેન્દ્ર મોદીનો છે. તેમણે સતત ૧૨ વર્ષ સુધી જગન્નાથમંદિરની રથયાત્રાની પહિંદ વિધિ કરી હતી. 
-જગન્નાથની રથયાત્રાની પ્રાચીન પરંપરા કોમી એખલાસનું પ્રતીક છે. લાખો શ્રદ્ધાળુઓ જગન્નાથના દર્શન કરીને ધન્યતા અનુભવે છે. તેમના આશીર્વાદ મેળવીને પોતાની જાતને પાવન માને છે.  (નરેન્દ્ર મોદી પહિંદવિધિ દરમિયાન)
 
અત્યાર સુધીના મહંત
૧૮૫૦ થી ૧૯૫૯ નરસિંહદાસજી મહારાજ
૧૯૫૯ થી ૧૯૭૧ સેવા દાસજી મહારાજ
૧૯૭૧ થી ૧૯૯૪ રામહર્ષદાસજી મહારાજ
૧૯૯૪ થી ૨૦૧૦ રામેશ્વરદાસજી મહારાજ
૨૦૧૦ થી  દિલીપદાસજી મહારાજ

ફેક્ટ ફાઇલ
 
રથયાત્રાના શરૂઆતના વર્ષોમાં માત્ર સાધુસંતો જ ભાગ લેતા હતા  જ્યારે હવે માત્ર અમદાવાદના જ નહીં પણ દેશભરના શ્રદ્ધાળુઓ ઉમટે છે. 

     જગન્નાથ મંદિરના પ્રથમ મહંત અને રથયાત્રાના પ્રેરક નરસિંહદાસજી મહારાજ જગનનાથ ભગવાનના સૌથી મોટા ભક્ત હતા. તેઓ વર્ષો સુધી ગુજરાતથીઓરિસ્સામાં  આવેલા જગન્નાથ મંદિરે ઉઘાડા પગે ચાલતા જતા હતા. આ ભક્તિથી જગન્નાથ પ્રસન્ન થયા હતા અને તેમને સ્વપ્નમાં આવીને યાત્રા શરૂ કરવાની પ્રેરણા આપી  હતી.
 
રથનો મનોરથ | નરસિંહદાસજી મહારાજે શહેરીજનોના દર્શનાર્થે અમદાવાદમાં રથયાત્રાનો પ્રારંભ કરાવ્યો હતો,અને આજે દાયકાઓ પછી પણ આ પરંપરા આજ સુધી યથાવત રહી છે. દર વર્ષે દર્શનાર્થીઓની સંખ્યામાં સતત વધારો થતો રહ્યો છે.
કાલી રોટી સફેદ દાલ: ૧૯૫૮ ની રથયાત્રા દરમ્યાન દેશભરમાંથી ઉમટેલા સાધુસંતોનો ભંડારો.
 
૧૯૬૪ અવિરત યાત્રા: આજે જ્વલ્લેજ જોવા મળતી
સરહદના ગાંધી રથયાત્રાની મુલાકાતે
૧૯૭૬ માં ખાન અબ્દુલ ગફાર ખાને રથયાત્રાની મુલાકાત  લીધી હતી અને સાધુગણને મળ્યા હતા.

મંદિરના પ્રિય હાથી સરજુ પ્રસાદની સમાધિ આસ્થાનું કેન્દ્
જગન્નાથ મંદિરના હાથીઓની સાથે મંદિરમાં બીજા અખાડાઓના મહંતો પણ પોતાના હાથીઓ મંદિરની સેવામાં આપે છે. તેવો જ એક હાથી સરજુ પ્રસાદ હતો. સરજુ પ્રસાદ મંદિરના તમામ સંતો-મહંતો અને લોકોનો માનીતો હતો. રથયાત્રામાં સૌથી આગળ તે ભાગ લેતો અને તેણે સૌથી વધારે વખત રથયાત્રામાં ભાગ પણ લીધો હતો. હાથી સરજુ પ્રસાદનું જ્યારે અવસાન થયુ ત્યારે આખા મંદિરમાં શોકની લાગણી વ્યાપી ગઇ હતી. આથી તે સમયના લોકોએ આ હાથીની સમાધિ બનાવવાનું નક્કી કર્યુ. તે સમયેરસપ્તઋષિ સ્મશાન રોડ પરની કેલિકોમીલની પાછળ આવેલી ખુલ્લી જગ્યામાં તેની સમાધિ બનાવવામાં આવી. ત્યારથી આ સમાધિ લોકોની આસ્થાનું કેન્દ્ર બન્યું છે.
                   
મોટીસંખ્યામાં લોકો આ “સરજુ પ્રસાદ”ની સમાધિના દર્શન કરવા જાય છે. આ સમાધિની ઉપર ભગવાન ગણેશજીની પ્રતિમાનું સ્થાપન કરવામાં આવ્યું છે. તેની આસપાસ રહેતા મુસ્લિમ સમાજના લોકો પણ તેમા આસ્થા રાખે છે. ૧૪૩ વર્ષ પહેલા  ૧૮૭૬ માં અમદાવાદમાં રથયાત્રાનો પ્રારંભ થયો. મહામંડળેશ્વર નૃસિંહદાસજીએ આ પવિત્રરથયાત્રાની શરૂઆત કરી હતી. જે પ્રથા આજે પણ અવિરત ચાલી રહી છે. જગન્નાથજીનું મંદિરથી નિકળતી રથયાત્રામાં અમદાવાદના જ નહીં પણ ચારે કોરના લોકો શ્રદ્ધા-ભક્તિ સાથે ઉમટી પડે છે.

    
૧૯૯૬ ખલાસીઓનું સમર્પણ | દરિયાપાર હોય કે દેશદેશાવર, ખલાસીઓ અચૂકપણે ડર અષાઢી બીજે ભગવાનના રથને ગંતવ્ય સ્થાને પહોંચાડવા હાજર થઈ જાય છે.

Nature Trail
  

Event Start Date : 26/06/2022
Event Last Date :   26/06/2022
Event Fees   Rs:   400.00/-   
Age Limit :   Appropriate to all ages.
Group Size: 30
Batches : 2 (15 Member in one group)


Established with the aim to provide education and to generate awareness about Nature Conservation, Maharashtra Nature Park (MNP) with its wonderful settings and rich biodiversity makes ideal place for this purpose.
Nature lovers eager to come here again and again are vouching that Nature Park makes ideal place to study biodiversity and to learn Nature ethics in absolute relaxed atmosphere.

 Biodiversity of Park: MNP is hotspot of Mumbai with 125 species of Birds, 85 species of Butterfly, 9 Species of snake and more than 300 species of plants.

You may come across: Nature/Photography/Butterfly/Medicinal Plant/ Birds  

	Entry Fee: Rs. 400/- per person Non-Refundable
(No charges are applicable for kids less than 3 years of age.)

	Itinerary:
•	Reporting Timing: 8:15 am
•	Trail Timing: 8:30 am to 10:30 am
•	End of the Trail: 10:30 am


Instructions:
1.  Carry an ample amount of water for yourself.
2.  Wear proper walking shoes. No sandals or slippers, please.
3.  Carry raincoat or umbrella with you.
4.  If possible wear Camouflage colour dress.

Registration link: https://imjo.in/hd42xT

For further query please contact: 9819026307

Venue: Maharashtra Nature Park Society, Sion-Bandra Link Road, Opp. PMGP Colony, Gate No. 2,  Dharavi, Mumabi-400 017

Die Geschichte der Wimpernverlängerung

Goldene Regeln der Hygiene

Wimpernverlängerung Step by Step

FAQ

Das Thema Refill

Ablauf

Am Vormittag konzentrieren wir uns auf den theoretischen Teil. Nach der Mittagspause gehen wir an das Üben am Übungskopf. Am Nachmittag bearbeiten Sie unter unserer Anleitung Ihr Modell. Am Ende der Schulung findet eine kleine theoretische Prüfung nach Miss Lashes Richtlinien statt.

Uhrzeiten können nach Bedarf ohne Preisaufschlag verlängert werden. Wir sind so lange für Sie da, wie Sie uns benötigen.

Die Zertifizierung erfolgt nach Miss Lashes Richtlinien. (Wir behalten es uns vor das Zertifikat nicht auszuhändigen.)

Snacks

Lash Lifting mit Brow Lifting Option

 

Lashlifting ist neben der Wimpernverlängerung auch eine der beliebtesten Beautytrends. Für diese Schulung gibt es keine Voraussetzungen und ganz egal ob du aus der Beauty Branche kommst oder du einfach als Quereinsteiger oder Anfänger in der Beauty Welt Fuß fassen möchtest, diese Schulung ist für dich super geeignet.

Auf dem deutschen Markt gibt es immer mehr Beauty Bars, die Lash & Brow Lifting anbieten, und alleine durch diese zwei Behandlungen umsatzstark profitieren. Auch als Zusatzleistung z.B beim Friseur, im Nagelstudio, in Sonnenstudios oder andernorts sind diese zwei Trendbehandlungen ein profitables Zusatzgeschäft. Wir zeigen dir, wie du die Naturwimpern deiner Kundinnen dunkler, länger und voller aussehen lassen kannst – ganz ohne Wimpernverlängerung und ohne Wimpernzange. Eine Behandlung in deinem Studio dauert ca. eine Stunde und ist eine gute Alternative zur Wimpernverlängerung. Sie eignet sich zudem hervorragend für all diejenigen, die aufgrund einer Allergie keine Wimpernverlängerung tragen können. Dies ist somit ein guter Nebenverdienst, ohne großen Aufwand. Nach einem ausführlichen theoretischen Teil arbeitest du an einem Modell um das Erlernte optimal zu vertiefen.

An dieser Trendbehandlung kommst du zurzeit nicht vorbei ￼ Das Brow Lifting ist der absolute Renner. Folgende Benefits bringt es mit sich:

 Es verleiht den Augenbrauen mehr Fülle

Optisch mehr Volumen

Haltbarkeit bis zu 8 Wochen

Brows on Fleek – Und das den ganzen Tag

Ein absolutes Muss für all diejenigen, die neue Kunden gewinnen möchten. Nicht nur der Effekt für die Kundin ist sehenswert, auch dein Nutzen als Stylist/in ist nicht zu unterschätzen. Eine Behandlungsdauer von etwa einer halben Stunde macht die Anwendung super profitabel. Du hast die Möglichkeit an diesem Tag auch die Kenntnisse des Brow Liftings zu erwerben. Der Aufpreis für diese Schulung liegt bei 100 Euro.

Solltest Du dich dafür entscheiden, dann teile uns das einfach per E-Mail mit.
