eventname: Trek To Dudhsagar Falls - Explore Dandeli @ 4950
description:
Trek To Dudhsagar Falls - Explore Dandeli @ 4950
Dates :- 02 & 03 - July 2022
Contact :- 9686633699 / 7975053556
Trek Free : INR 4950/Person
Registration Link : http://bit.ly/dudhsagarfallstrek

==================
Overview
Dudhsagar Falls (literally Sea of Milk) is a four-tiered waterfall located on the Mandovi River in the Indian state of Karnataka and Goa. It is 60 km from Panaji by road and is located on the Madgaon-Belagavi rail route about 46 km east of Madgaon and 80 km south of Belagavi. Dudhsagar Falls is amongst India's tallest waterfalls with a height of 310 m (1017 feet) and an average width of 30 meters (100 feet).

Dandeli 
Dandeli is a town in the western Indian state of Karnataka. The Dandeli Wildlife Sanctuary, with its trails and dense forests, is home to animals including black panthers, monkeys, and elephants, as well as many bird species. A temple stands at the entrance to the limestone Kavala Caves, known for their stalagmite formations. West of the caves, Anshi National Park encompasses the Kali Tiger Reserve.

What you Expect from the Trek
=> Dudhsagar falls
=> Dandeli  Water Activities 
=> Falls - Streams
=> Breath taking views
=> Greenery ,Chill cold
=> Mandovi River

Brief Itinerary
---------------------------------
Day 0 
Friday Night 8:00 PM:- Pick Up From Bangalore(Multiple locations)
--------------------------------
Day 1

• Saturday Morning Reach to Dandeli resort and fresh up there
• Visit to Ganesh Gudi for Dandeli water activities.
• Come back to homestay and have lunch. Relax and play games with Coffee and Snacks.
• Night Campfire(Optional), games and Dinner with memorable moments

Day 2
• Freshen up and have breakfast - Journey towards Collum
• Trek to Dudhsagar falls viewpoint ( try to cover both viewpoints near the river and on the bridge)
• Journey back to Kulem to board the vehicle
• Start journey to Bangalore - Dinner - 

Day 3
Reach To Bangalore (05:30 AM)

--------------------------------------
Summary
Event Date:- 02 and 03 - July - 2022
We will be starting from Bangalore on Friday night and returning Monday morning
Theme:- Dudhsagar Falls visit & Dandeli exploration
Duration Of the Event:- 2 days and 3 nights
Places:- Dudhsagar Falls & Dandeli Forest
Grade:- Moderate
Trek Distance:- 22 KM
Transportation:- T T/ Minibus
Team Size:- 12/20/30
Trek Fee : INR 4950/Person 
Food:- Veg & Nonveg 
Accommodation:- Resort (Rooms/ Dormitory)
Includes:- Transportation(B'lore to B'lore), 5 times food, forest permission fee, accommodation, goa entry tax, instructor fee, (If you are interested in Water Activities at Dandeli it will be self sponsored)
Sunday dinner is self sponsored

---------------------------------------

You Ought to Bring
-----------------------------------------------------
•       Mask & sanitizer
•  Rain Coat is mandatory 
•	Three sets of clothes (cotton t-shirts, pants, shorts, etc. Pls avoid jeans as they are uncomfortable when wet) 
•      There is swimming pool in the resort that we have booked... So carry your swimwear	
• Rain Coat is a Mandatory & winter jacket.
•	Good 30 Ltr Back pack, Plastic Carry bag (2 Piece) 
•	Well worn Trekking shoes with good Grip (1 Pair Flip flop)
•	Toilet kit (brush, toothpaste, comb, soap)
•	Torch with batteries is mandatory
•	Any Government Issued ID Cards
•	Minimum One-litre water bottle 
•	Sun cap, Socks, Towel

Payment Details
=====================
Confirm with Advance Amount Rs 2000 or full amount and the remaining amount will be collected on the day of Travel.

Note 
-----------------------------------------------

* Adventurous trek/trip does NOT come with luxury, so please have the mindset accordingly
* Dandeli Water Activities not included in the package amount.
* Trek fee hiked Rs 400 due to increased on Transportation cost & Forest permission cost
* Smoking & Drinking strictly prohibited during the event
* Strictly follow the Reporting time, Program schedule and Instructions given by the Organizers through the entire duration of the program.
* Please don't throw the plastic and garbage in Forest
* No door drops/pickups.
* Sunday Dinner will be self-sponsored.
* Event Schedule, route and Plans are subject to change in case of any inconvenience that occurred at the time of tour without any prior intimation. Travelers have to adjust to any such consequence.
* Mad Adventurers reserves all rights to modify or cancel the trekking event due to unavoidable circumstances.

eventname: WSR Monsoon Trek to Kalavantin on 16th July 2022
description:
Short Info:

Type: One day trek

Height: 2330 Ft Approx

Duration: 3 Hrs Approx

Grade: Easy

Base Village: Thakurwadi

Cost: 799/- Per Person

             749/- WSR Members

 

About:

The trek to Kalavantin Durg is one of the most dangerous and adrenaline-pumping adventures across India which is strictly not recommended for beginners, or those with vertigo or fear of heights. This trek first begins with an easy uphill climb to Prabalmachi, the base village of Kalavatin, followed by summiting the Kalavantin fortress. To reach the fortress, you will be ascending through steep and narrow rock-cut steps with no iron rails or any support on one side. The trail gets steeper and vertigo-inducing as you make your way up while enjoying the incredible views of the green jungle below. During rains, the trail gets slippery and you should be extremely careful while trekking, especially during the descent.

 

Itinerary:

Train Time Table: Thane to Panvel:

06:37 am, Khoparkhairne

06:49 am, Nerul

03:00 pm, Start Descending to Base Village

08:30 pm, Reach Mumbai (tentatively)

A bottle of water (atleast 3 Litres) must

1 torch (a must) with spare batteries (a must)

Rain cheater

Bunch of Papers, Camera, Cap etc.

Medicine those if u require usually (Optional)

A good trekking shoes, extra pair of floaters.

A haversack to put in all the things to be carried....so that one has ones hands free while trekking.

Please avoid wearing Gold and other ornaments.

eventname: WSR Outdoors Bike Ride To Malshej Ghat On 03th July 2022
description:
Short Info:

Location: Malshej Ghat, Thane, Maharashtra

Duration: 1 Day

Type: Bike Ride

Level: Moderate

Cost: 900/- Per Person

             850/- WSR Members

Leads: Deepak / Meraj

 

About:

Malshej Ghat is a mountain pass in the Western Ghats range in the Thane district of Maharashtra, India. The site is nestled in the lofty rugged hills of the Western Ghats. A nice view of valleys is one of the major attractions here. The view from behind the MTDC resort is a must-see. It is also famous for dark woods and the animals inside. This animal includes tigers, leopards, rabbits and peacocks etc. But truly a famous place near Malshej Ghat is Khireshwar which is 2/3 km from rest house.

Through Khireshwar village, one can visit the famous Harishchandragad also. One of the beauties here are many waterfalls in the hilly regions. Various waterfalls from small up to the huge ones are really worth to see and many are right next to the highway.

 

Itinerary:

Early morning meet at Teen Hath Naka-Thane by 06:30 am.

7:30 am, secong meeting point durgadi killa circle (Kalyan)

Proceed towards Malshej Ghat. En-route breakfast.

Enjoy the Waterfalls. Reach at the top of the ghat and explore the beautiful surrounding and the green environment.

Post Lunch, proceed back towards Mumbai.

Reach Thane by 08:00 pm.

Tour concludes with Happy Memories

 

Includes:

Breakfast

Lunch

Evening Refreshment

Expertise Charge

 

Excludes:

Petrol / Maintenance Cost

Any Kind of Insurance

In case, of a single rider, the petrol and maintenance charges have to be paid by rider alone.

Wanderingsoulriders will provide info about a willing participant who can accompany you,

and share the expenses. This depends on availability of such willing participants.

 

Important things to be carried:

Identity proof.

Legal papers of bike.

Helmet / Gloves / Knee Pad / Elbow Pad.

Extra Pair of clothes.

Sleeping Bag / Chaddar

Medicines, camera (optional).

Please pack bags accordingly to protect them from rain.

 

Important Points to keep in mind:

1 The leader's decision will be final and binding on all members. No Arguments will be entertained.

2 Participants or Members are responsible for his/her own safety and baggage.

3 Over-speeding will not be tolerated as usual, because mishaps cost yours as well as whole group's time..

4 Don't even think or assume that it is a LUXURY trip, please be ready to rough yourself out or else please stay at home for comfort.

5 Alcohol is strictly prohibited on the Rides. Anyone found in possession of the same or consuming it will be expelled from the ride. NO REFUND will be provided.

 

6 “WSR Outdoors” would not be responsible for any uncertainties happening to him and also the members who accompany him.

 

COVID -19 Checklist for Participants:
Any travel history to/from any foreign country/containment or red zone in the past 14 days
Any symptoms suggestive of COVID-19 during the past 14 days
Age above 45 yrs participants are not allowed to join any events till further notice
Riders & pillions must carry sufficient amount of sanitizer, masks, gloves, and a personal medical kit for the respective days of the trek.
Apart from the above, Riders & pillions  must make sure they carry all the required things,  Remember no sharing will be allowed. Riders & pillions  will be responsible for disposable of their own items. 
COVID -19 Guidelines for Participants:
Mask is compulsory to join for any events
Keep at least 1 meter distance during all social and inter personal interactions
Avoid Touching frequently touched objects and surfaces with bare hands
Living with Corona is the new normal. We must learn to take care of ourselves. It is our responsibility to keep ourselves and our Nation safe from Corona. While doing that we must follow our dreams too.
Notes: Please keep in mind that we shall change our policies and procedures based on Government regulations in future. As you know, there can be last-minute announcements and we will have to follow them. However, we shall try to abide by the Government rules keeping in mind the welfare of our trekkers.
 Please read our \Terms & Conditions\" before joining for any events.

Event Name: Dudhsagar Waterfall trek
Batch 2: 9th - 11th July 2022
Price Rs 3149/- per person (Mumbai - Mumbai)
Location: Goa
Type: Trail
Grade: Medium

About:
Dudhsagar Waterfalls- springing from a lofty height of 600m is located on the Goa-Karnataka border. It lies at a distance of 60 km from Panaji and 10 km from Colem Railway Station. Dudhsagar Falls (literally Sea of Milk ) is a tiered waterfall located on the Mandovi River in the Indian state of Goa on Goa's border with Karnataka state. It is four-tiered.

Dudhsagar is one of the world's most exquisite falls. It lies high up in the Mandovi River's watershed and so is not particularly spectacular during the dry season. During the monsoon season, however, the falls are transformed into one of the most powerful falls in India. 

Dudhsagar Falls is listed as India's fifth tallest waterfall and is 227th in the world at 310 m. The water plummets hundreds of meters (over a thousand feet) in large volumes during the rainy monsoon season, forming one of the most spectacular natural phenomena in Goa. It is a major part of the Goa ecosystem. It is a four-tiered waterfall with a total height of 310 meters (1017 feet) and an average width of 30 meters (100 feet)

One has to get down at Kulem (Collem) railway station and walk towards the falls which are about 11 km away. It normally takes 2–3 hours to reach. The famous photograph of Trains passing through before the waterfalls can be seen in this route and also the complete stretch of the falls will be visible while you hike towards the waterfalls.

Itinerary:
Dudhsagar waterfall Trek Itinerary

Day 1:
4:00 pm Meet Adventure Geek Leader at LTT. We will be catching 22113 LTT KVCL Super Fast Express which leaves at 4.55 pm.
08:00 pm Dinner time (Bring your Own Dinner)
Will be having a few games too while traveling.
10:00 pm Good Night!!!
Day 2:

04:00 am - Reach Madgaon station, will be going Kulem by Pvt Vehicle.
05:30 am - Reach Kulem, Freshen up, breakfast time, and gear up for the Trek.
06:00 am - Introduction round and start trekking towards the Dudhsagar Waterfall (14 Km) by track route
09:30 am - Reach Dudhsagar Base Waterfall and enjoy the scenic view of the waterfalls and the journey too.
11:30 am - Start Return Journey towards starting point.
03:00 pm - Reach Base Point, Freshen up and have lunch.
04:30 pm - Leave for Madgaon by Pvt vehicle.
06:30 pm - Reach Madgaon and Catch 07.15 Matsyagandha Express (12620).
08:00 pm - Dinner Time (Need to bring on your own)
Day 3:

05:00 am - Reach Panvel (Pune Participants will get down at Panvel and catch the next train for Home)
05:57 am - Reach Thane
06:35 am - Reach LTT and leave for your respective homes with memories.
Please Note: Participants traveling from Pune need to reach Panvel station latest by 3.30 pm on Day 1 as we will be catching 12619 MATSYAGANDHA Express.

While returning participants will be reaching Panvel by 5:00 am early morning.

Includes:
Sleeper Class tickets from Mumbai - Mumbai
Pvt Vehicle from Madgaon - Madgaon
Dudhsagar Jungle entry tickets
Breakfast and Lunch on Day 2
Expertise and guide charges

Excludes:
Dinner while Travelling in Train (To and Fro)
Packaged Water/Beverages
Any kind of insurance, Softdrinks etc.
Anything other than above-mentioned inclusions.
All expenses incurred due to unforeseen and unavoidable circumstances like roadblocks, bad weather.

Things to Carry :
- 3 liters of water (Must)
- Raincoat / Poncho / Umbrella (Must)
- Torch with extra batteries (Must)
- Full sleeve T-shirts and full pant. For girls full neck t-shirt. (Must)
- Good trekking shoes, an extra pair of socks (Must)
- Warm clothes / Shawl / bed-sheet (for rest)
- Towel, a napkin, Extra Pair of clothes (Must)
- Carry 3-4 extra carry-bags
- Packs things properly to protect from rain
- Camera, Cap etc. (Optional)
- Electrolyte packets as energy drinks (optional)
- Carry eatable like fruits, dry fruits to munch on during trek and to avoid dehydration.
- A haversack to put in all the things.
- Good to have stick for support.

U can pay by Credit/Debit card/ Net banking
Add money to your PayTM wallet and then transfer it to bank / PayTM
or www.adventuregeekk.com

A/c No. 319102010805655
IFSC Code- UBIN0531910
Bank Name Union Bank Of India
Branch- Princess Street Branch, Mumbai.
Call/Whatsapp Vinay:- 9004675388

RULES:
– No smoking.
– No plastic littering.
– Wear full sleeves, full track suite to avoid mosquito.
– No jeans/skin tight clothes.
– Proper footwear/shoes are essential for the trek.
– Conserve and preserve our heritage.
– No deo / perfume. After a trek it’s OK.
– We reserves all right to change/deviate/cancel the plans without any prior notice.
– No Extra adventure/out of itinerary behavior during trek.
– Trek leader’s decision will be final and binding.
– Photographs were taken during the activity which can be used for publicity purpose.
– Each member will be responsible for his/her own safety, Jewellery, Cash and baggage.

REFUND AND CANCELLATION POLICY:
⏺Cancellation prior to 30 days - 75% will be refunded
⏺Cancellation before 15 days of event - 50% refundable
⏺Cancellation before 7 days of event - 25% refundable
⏺Above and after no refund– No cancellation amount will be refunded on Advance Payment.

MEDICAL DISCLAIMER:
– It is most essential to be fit and fine before heading for trekking.
– While planning your trekking trip, it is preferable to have a medical fitness check up done.
– If suffering from any kind of allergy or ailment, do carry proper prescribed medicines to prevent serious health problem including heatstroke, sever headache, cough, dehydration and hypothermia.
– Participants suffering from chronic conditions like asthma, bronchitis, blood pressure, migraine, diabetes etc should seek their physicians advice before coming.

– All the activities & programs carry an amount of risk of injury and you are aware that outdoor activities have an inherent risk of personal injury.
– You are joining an outdoor activity where any incident(reasons beyond control (like Natural calamities, riots, political uncertainty, public transport failure etc.)/ Natural calamity can happen & you agree that organizer shall not be held responsible for the any accident, mishap (including death) caused by any circumstances. Refund shall be payable with respect to the given refund norms.
– Adventure Geek reserves all rights to modify/change the camp/ program and to pre-pone (advance)/postpone the event and Adventure Geek will not be liable to refund booking charges in such a case.

See you at the Event

Bhandardara, a serene & unspoiled beauty situated in middle of Western Ghats in Nagar district offers you an overwhelming experience. A trip to Bhandardara especially in monsoon bounded with majestic waterfalls, hidden valleys and different shades of green all around makes for a great treat to the eyes. A long exposure shot of various waterfalls will surely give you dreamy frame. Experience and click the lush green surrounding with many natural waterfalls, dams and valley. Exploring Sandhan valley in monsoon is totally a different experience and we can able to click the reverse waterfall in Sandhan valley from one side with yellow flowers in foreground.


Scheduled dates - 20th - 21st August 2022 (2D/1N)

Day 1

Our journey starts early morning, the pick up is from Vashi at 5:30 am. Subsequent pickup points include Ghansoli, Airoli, Mulund, Thane, Teen hath Naka. We will have breakfast on our way to Mumbai-Nasik highway (Near Kasara). We should reach Bhandardara by lunch time via Igatpuri. While entering to Bhandardara, we will have our first session of shooting two adjacent waterfalls. After reaching, check in hotel have lunch and take some rest. Visit the surrounding waterfalls post noon. Join our expert for an on field photographic guidance. We will have informal discussions on tips and tricks of landscape photography in evening. Join the group discussion over dinner. 

Day 2

Today we will explore Bhandardara. We will be visiting the dam and the surrounding areas, we will have our lunch on the way, we will proceed to some unexplored waterfalls, which offer abundant photographic opportunities of landscapes, waterfalls. Post Lunch, we will have our discussion and backpack for return journey to Mumbai. Post workshop mentor will assist on post processing images clicked during phototour.


We will be staying on twin sharing basis in a decent hotel with separate beds. Hotel will be well sanitized before we check-in and in between. To avoid cross contamination and to keep social distancing beds are placed accordingly. Hotel staff are well-trained and keeping social distance. 


Things to carry
Wide angle lens
Carry fully charged batteries for your camera
Carry battery charger. Carry extra pack of camera batteries
Carry backup memory cards / HDD storage drives, Laptop
ND filter (minimum 3 stops) and polariser filter (like CPL)
A sturdy tripod is a MUST.
Wired/wireless remote trigger, camera timer will also work.
It is advisable to carry basic first aid along with you.
Do carry protective rain gears (Umbrella must) for yourself and for your equipment. We find Ponchos very good.
Carry basic first aid along with you. Carry regular medicines if you are on medication.
Equipment available on rental - please mail us at rentals@dcpexpeditions.com.

On-field learning from the experts is said to be one of the best methods of improving your skill-set. Our expert will hand hold you at every possible step for a better understanding of perspectives, camera controls and how to make use of the best opportunities to get better images. The training will focus on the following

How to shoot waterfalls
Long exposure control.
Best camera setting for waterfall shoot.
How to shoot timelaps (clouds)
How to bracket the exposures.

Ashok Dewangan is a  photographic artist and educator, with a passion for Photography. He likes to do experiments with various genres of photography, his work is recognized on various national and international photographic platforms. He loves to explore hidden places for landscape photography and devotes his non-office hours to travelling to new places and doing experiments with photography. His core area of work is Travel and Landscape. He is efficient in Post-Processing, he teaches post-processing from basic to advanced levels. To date, he has taught post-processing to hundreds of participants. He always believes in knowledge sharing. He is associated with DCP as a Panel Expert.

Rs 10000  inclusive of all taxes

*To know charges for foreign nationals please write to info@dcpexpeditions.com

Cost includes

Accomodation for 1 Night on twin sharing.
Meals (B/f, Lunch, Dinner)
Tempo traveler or equivalent A/C vehicle from Vashi to location and return.
DCP photography expert.
All Taxes and service charges.
Cost does not include:

Travel from your location to meeting point at Vashi
Camera-fee, if any.
Mineral Water, Soft Drinks, Laundry Charges, Phone Calls, Tips etc.
Any kind of insurance, Medical or/and Emergency Charges.
Any extra meals not included in the above itinerary.
Cancellation policy

All cancellations before 30 days of the event date - 100% refund
All cancellations between 20 - 30 days of the event date - 50% refund
All cancellations within 20 days of the event date - No refund possible

Konnagar - Heritages along the Hooghly 
Sunday, June 26th, 2022
7:30am to 3:30pm 

* Meeting point: Howrah Station Platform no. 1 by 7:30am
* Finishing at Uttarpara Railway Station by 3pm. Return to Howrah Station by 3:30pm.

Have you checked out Konnagar, on the west Bank of Hooghly? With all the buzz of the Europeans not very far from here, Konnagar had been a place of many pioneering activities and residences of some well known personalities of Bengal. And so we have a heritage trail worth knowing and understanding. It is a pity that many are being slowly lost to oblivion. In this tour we will try and discover the heritages in this small town. We feel Konnagar has never been highlighted properly with all its rich history. It is always the towns of Serampore, Chinsurah, Chandannagore,  and Bandel that have grabbed all the attention.  Come and spend a day with us exploring Konnagar. You will surely be enlightened!

TRANSPORT :
Inside Konnagar, Auto/Toto will be used to take you through the places. 

FOOD PLAN:
1. Breakfast and tea at Konnagar from the road side eateries will be served
2. Lunch of noodles and chicken tossed in sauce (or fried) at a lovely place - 'Boi Thek' at Uttarpara, will be served at this last stop. 
3. Packaged drinking water

WE DO NOT GUARANTEE ENTRY INSIDE THE HERITAGES AND OTHER PLACES OF INTEREST. IF THEY ARE OPEN AND ALLOW VISITORS THEN ONLY WE CAN GAIN AN ENTRY. PLEASE CO-OPERATE WITH US IN MAKING THIS TRIP A MEMORABLE ONE.

Bangalore❤️, We got a gig alert for you!

We have lined up for an ecstatic Saturday evening at Hotel Royal Orchid Lawns for a special edition of Azure Ind as we bring down one of the finest LIVE acts Teho having releases on the top notch labels: CERCLE , HERZBLUT, LABO T and more. He is all set to take us for a melodic journey with his music. We also got the best homegrown acts lined up for you to kickoff the sublime vibes. We are all set to give you the best of experience by our massive production that leaves a memory in your heart. See you all there and yes, grab those tickets before its sold out.

About the artist:
Teho was born in 1990 in a small town near Montpellier, in the south of France. At the age of 11, a bass guitar in hand, he tries to play all the songs he likes. He discovered the world of electronic music when he was 15 but it was two years later that he decided to start producing music after seeing Daft Punk in concert. Also inspired by the musical universe of the legendary club Bar Live After, it naturally turns towards a melodic techno style influenced by artists such as James Holden, or even Stephan Bodzin.

Today, counting several millions plays on his tracks, and playing his music all over the world, Teho has found his place in the electronic music scene. With his own musical universe, both dreamy and melancholic, but also full of energy, Teho succeeded to combine different musical genres to create his own hybrid and melodic techno, almost electronica.

#bangalore #techno #melodic #live #underground #ravers #bangaloretechno #events #weekendparties #technobangalore #technoindia #nightlife

What do you get when storytellers forget their stories? A cowardly bat, a magician who has run out of tricks, a velvet red mite that wants to conquer and plunder, a tea seller with a book & a moon that goes missing! All these colourful characters come together to help the storytellers find their stories!

Break.Free is a 75 minute Live original musical from the house of Crea-Shakthi & Idea of Joy. The Play mixes live music and storytelling by merging 5 original tales created by Crea-Play, the storytelling app. 

The Play is a fun evening for the entire family but especially for children aged 3+ - The original stories will have you all tapping your feet and singing along with the performers on stage and the stories will hit home with joy and relevance.

उत्तराखंड भारत का एक खूबसूरत राज्य हैं और इसकी राजधानी देहरादून हैं। उत्तराखंड देवभूमि या देवों की भूमि के रूप में भी प्रसिद्ध हैं। उत्तराखंड को उत्तर प्रदेश राज्य से काट कर एक अलग राज्य बनाया गया हैं, जिसे पहले उत्तरांचल के रूप में भी जाना जाता था। उत्तराखंड एक ऐसा स्थान है जो न केवल हिमालय की खूबसूरती का दावा करता हैं बल्कि एक सांस्कृतिक सभ्यता और लोकाचार की भावना को भी प्रकट करता हैं। राज्य में ओक, बिर्च, चांदी के फेयर और रोडोडेंड्रोन के साथ-साथ यहां की खड़ी पहाड़ी, ढलानों पर चढ़ने का खूबसूरत अनुभव भी पर्यटक ले सकते हैं।

यदि आप उत्तराखंड और यहां के पर्यटक स्थलों के बारे में जानना चाहते हैं तो हमारे इस लेख को पूरा जरूर पढ़े।                                                           उत्तराखंड भारत का एक बहुत ही लोकप्रिय तीर्थ स्थल है और इसी राज्य से हिन्दू धर्म में सबसे पवित्र और पावन मानी जाने वाली नदियों में से दो नदियां गंगा और यमुना का उद्गम स्थल है। उत्तराखंड तीर्थो के चारो धाम हैं और हिन्दू धर्म के मुताबिक श्रद्धालुओं के सबसे पवित्र चार स्थल – केदारनाथ, गंगोत्री, यमुनोत्री और बद्रीनाथ उत्तराखंड राज्य की गोद में बसे हुए हैं।                            उत्तराखंड राज्य में कई हिल स्टेशनहैं। जैसे – अल्मोड़ा, कौसानी, भीमताल, मसूरी, नैनीताल, धनोल्टी, लैंसडाउन, सटल और रानीखेत हैं। जोकि पर्यटकों को अपनी ओर आकर्षित करती हैं। गर्मियों में ठंडा रहने की वजह और अन्य क्रियाकलापों के लिए भी इन हिल स्टेशन का महत्व बहुत अधिक बढ़ जाता हैं। पर्यटक गर्मी के मौसम और छुट्टियां बिताने के लिए यहां भारी संख्या में आते हैं।                                   उत्तराखंड राज्य पर्यटक के लिहाज से टूरिस्टों के लिए वेहद ही खास हैं। पर्यटक यहां भारी तादाद में आते हैं खासकर गर्मियों का मौसम पर्यटकों को बहुत अधिक लुभाता हैं। तो आइए हम आपको उतराखंड राज्य के प्रमुख पर्यटक स्थलों की जानकारी देते हैं जहां आप घूमने जा सकते हैं।                                                ऋषिकेश पर्यटन स्थल उत्तराखंड राज्य में स्थित हैं और यह गंगा और चंद्रभागा के अभिसरण के साथ साथ हिमालय की तलहटी में कई प्राचीन और भव्य मंदिरों के लिए दुनिया भर में जाना जाता हैं। इसके अलावा यह जगह लौकप्रिय कैफे, योग आश्रम और साहसिक खेलों का केंद्र भी है। ऋषिकेश आध्यात्मिक और एड्रेनालाईन पंपिंग का एक अनौखा है। पिछले कुछ वर्षों में उत्तराखंड लौकप्रिय पर्यटक स्थल ऋषिकेश को भारत के एडवेंचर स्पोर्ट्स के केंद्र के रूप में भी विकसित किया गया है। क्योंकि यहां व्हाइट वाटर राफ्टिंग, फ्लाइंग फॉक्स, माउंटेन बाइकिंग, बंजी जंपिंग आदि विकल्पों की शानदार भीड़ देखने को मिलती हैं।                                      नैनीताल उत्तराखंड राज्य के सबसे खूबसूरत पर्यटन स्थलों में से एक हैं, जोकि कुमाऊं पहाड़ियों के बीच में स्थित एक विलक्षण पर्वतीय स्थल है। जिसे ‘नैनी झील’ के नाम से भी जाना जाता है। प्राकृतिक सुंदरता और झीलों की नगरी के रूप में प्रसिद्ध उत्तराखंड का नैनीताल बर्फ से ढकी पहाड़ियों और शांत झीलों के साथ एक आकर्षण उत्त्पन करता हैं। नैनीताल में साहसिक गतिविधियों को भी किया जा सकता हैं।                                                             मसूरी पर्यटक स्थल दुनिया भर के पर्यटकों को अपनी खूबियों और विशेषताओं के लिए अपनी ओर आकर्षित करने में कामयाब रहा हैं। गढ़वाल हिमालय पर्वत माला की तलहटी के बीचो बीच स्थित मसूरी पर्यटक स्थल जिसे “क्वीन ऑफ द हिल्स” के नाम से भी जाना जाता हैं। मसूरी की ऊंचाई समुद्र तल से लगभग 7000 फीट है। पूरे वर्ष एक शांत और सुखद जलवायु का अनुभव कराता है।                              उत्तराखंड का पर्यटन स्थल बद्रीनाथ नर और नारायण पर्वत श्रृंखलाओं के बीचो बीच नीलकंठ पर्वत शिखर पर स्थित चारों धामों में से एक तीर्थ स्थल हैं। बद्रीनाथ धाम भगवान विष्णु को समर्पित एक तीर्थस्थल है जो प्रतिबर्ष लाखों तीर्थ यात्रियों की मेजबानी करता है। बद्रीनाथ धाम का उल्लेख विभिन्न वेदों में भी किया गया है। उत्तराखंड का पर्यटन स्थल बद्रीनाथ हिंदू पौराणिक कथाओं में उल्लेखित होने के कारण विशेष रूप से भगवान शिव से संबंधित है।    भारत के सात सबसे पवित्र शहरों में शुमार हरिद्वार उत्तराखंड राज्य के गढ़वाल क्षेत्र में गंगा नदी के तट पर स्थित एक खूबसूरत प्राचीन शहर है। हरिद्वार शहर के आश्रमों, मंदिरों और संकरी गलियों  से संपन्न शहर है। लाखों की संख्या में भक्त पवित्र गंगा नदी में डुबकी लगाने आते हैं। प्रत्येक बारह वर्षों में एक बारहरिद्वार में विश्व प्रसिद्ध कुंभ के मेले का आयोजन किया जाता हैं। कुम्भ के मेले में शामिल होने और उसका आनंद लेने के लिए पूरे भारत वर्ष से पर्यटक आते हैं। कुम्भ का मेला हरिद्वार के अलावा भारत के मात्र तीन शहर प्रयागराज, नासिक और उज्जैन में लगता हैं।                                                            जिम कॉर्बेट नेशनल पार्क उत्तराखंड राज्य में हिमालय की तलहटी के बीच में स्थित एक आकर्षित नेशनल पार्क हैं। भारत के सबसे पुराना राष्ट्रीय उद्यानो में से एक जिम कॉर्बेट नेशनल पार्क की स्थापना सन 1936 में हैली नेशनल पार्क के रूप में गयी थी। जिम कार्बेट नेशनल पार्क में रॉयल बंगाल टाइगर की गंभीर रूप से लुप्तप्राय प्रजातियों का निवास स्थान बनाया गया हैं। हिमालय की तलहटी में रामगंगा नदी के किनारे स्थित जिम कार्बेट नेशनल पार्क में लगभग 580 पक्षी प्रजातियों, 50 प्रजातियों के पेड़ और जानवरों की लगभग 50 प्रजातिया,  25 सरीसृप प्रजातिया के साथ साथ 500 से अधिक वर्ग मीटर के क्षेत्र में विस्तृत है।                                      उत्तराखंड का पर्यटन स्थल यमुनोत्री यमुना नदी की उत्पत्ति के रूप में श्रद्धालुओं के लिए एक विशेष पर्यटन स्थल बन चुका हैं और यह छोटे चार धाम में से एक हैं। 3293 मीटर की ऊंचाई पर स्थित योमुनोत्री धाम गढ़वाल हिमालय की गोद में बसा हुआ हैं। हिंदू पौराणिक कथाओं के अनुसार यम की बहन के रूप में यमुना को मौत के देवता के रूप में प्रतिष्ठित करती हैं। यह भी माना जाता है कि यमुना में स्नान करने से जीवन के अंतिम समय में मृत्यु दर्द रहित हो सकती है।

Coorg - the land of greenery, spices, waterfalls, acres, and acres of Coffee estate and shimmering streams. Coorg a landlocked district in Karnataka and is situated on the slopes of Western Ghats. The best thing about this scenic paradise is its people. Coorg belongs to a martial race and is famous for its hospitality. Coorg is a tourist paradise for nature lovers and bird watchers. India has over 1250 species and 25% of them are found in Coorg alone. One of the major attractions is Bylekuppe –India’s largest Tibetan monastery with 7000 monks and nuns. The gold-coated Buddhist statues in the monastery are imposing and unique, reflecting the rich cultural heritage of the Tibetans. There is another scenic spot famous for its elephant training camp. It is also an ideal place for angling in the swirling waters of the Cauvery. No wonder it’s called Scotland of India.


Flapper Route : Mangalore - Coorg - Mangalore 


Flapper Highlights : Waterfall Hikes, Slowing down, Social Detox and trekking

The state of Meghalaya unravels itself in the midst of the cloud. Located in the hills of eastern sub-Himalayans. Meghalaya is a Sanskrit word that literally translates to ‘abode of cloud’.  A more apt and suitable name would not be possible to describe Meghalaya. It is part of the seven sisters clan in North East India. It is known to be one of the wettest places on the Earth and is a delight to visit. It is made up of Khasi, Jaintia, and Garo Hills and has a rich tribal presence. The culture is so different and unlike any part of India that it makes it a true joy to visit and explore.


Flapper Route : Guwahati - Shillong - Dawki - Cherapunjee - Guwahati

Flapper highlights: 

- Boating at Dawki
- Village Walking Trails at Mawlynong Village
- Drive to the border village of India
- Caving
- Rainforest trekking (Optional and only if weather permits)

Bli med Tommy Solberg og Rajat på uforglemmelige dager i India. Vi har hovedfokus på tiger og vi besøker de beste plassene der disse majestetiske dyrene befinner seg. Dette er en mektig foto-opplevelse du sent vil glemme! Nasjonalparkene Bandhavgarh, Pench og Kanha sørger for å holde deg i aktivitet med fantastiske naturopplevelser på løpende bånd. Her finnes ikke bare tiger, leopard men også leppebjørn, gaur, amfibier og reptiler, antiloper og et yrende fugle- og planteliv.
Det er også mye fuglefoto muligheter på denne turen.
Safariene foregår i åpne jeeps, og vi plasserer kun fire i hver bil for at vi skal få nok armslag til fotografering, Denna turen er planlagt å maksimere fotomuligheter.
Her er uforglemmelige opplevelser som venter på deg!

Krishna’s Tour of India first began in 1999 and has continued to grow in popularity ever since.

Visit our website Krishna’s Tour Of India .com .au for more information ℹ️ 

This annual tour visits three of the major pilgrimage sites in India – Sri Vrindavan Dham, Sri Mayapura Dham and Sri Jagannath Puri Dham.

This unforgettable journey of 18 days promises to uncover the mysteries of India’s ancient spiritual culture. 

Our transformative journey takes us to heart of the Bhakti tradition, which practices loving service and devotion to the Supreme Lord, Shree Krishna. 

Traveling with other like-minded pilgrims, you will become immersed in the sights and sounds of the timeless devotional culture of India. 

Past participants of the tour have dubbed it “Krishna’s Gourmet Tour of India”, as each day you will treated to some of the most delicious and exotic meals that you will ever experience in your life!

This year we will begin in Vrindavana, where we will discover the wonders of Krishna’s 5,000 year old playground. 

We will visit ancient temples and markets, circumambulate Govardhana hill, India’s most sacred mountain, and delight in meeting the saints, animals and trees who reside in this holiest of all places.

We then travel to Jagannath Puri, the “Temple City” on the coast of Orissa. 

There we will move around the town to uncover the significance of this sacred area. We will partake of the famous Jagannath Prasada as well as bathing in the Indian Ocean just outside our door. 

And finally we will move on to Mayapura, the appearance place of Lord Chaitanya, the founder of the Hare Krishna movement.

Here we will spend a week visiting sacred sites, bathing in the Ganges and participating in some of the extraordinary festivals with the locals. 


Krishna’s Tour Of India Itinerary 

September 5th – 22nd 2022


Day 1: Vrndavana internal Parikrama
Day 2: Radha Kunda
Day 3: Govardhan Parikrama
Day 4: Varsana
Day 5: Vrndavana external Parikrama
Day 6: Nandagram 
Day 7: Loi Bazaar Shopping 
Day 8: Travel to Bhubaneswar then Jagannatha Puri 
Day 9: Gambhira, Siddha Bhakula
Day 10: Jagannatha-Ballabha Gardens, Gundica Mandir, Indradyumna Sarovara
Day 11: Tota-Gopinatha, Cakata-parvata, Hari dasa Thakura’s Samadhi
Day 12: Travel to Bhubaneswar then Mayapura 
Day 13: Mayapur Candrodaya Mandir
Day 14: Yoga-pitha, Srivasa-angam
Day 15: Godrumadvip, Bhaktivinod Thakura’s residence
Day 16: Chaitanya Math
Day 17: Navadvipa, Jagannatha dasa Babaji’s Bhajana Kutir
Day 18: Jagannatha Mandira

(This itinerary may vary slightly during trip)

The tour begins on September 5th in Vrindavana.

It is up to the individual to organize their own international flights & transport to Vrindavana.

If you would like to travel with us internationally, and then from Delhi to Vrindavana, please contact us.

We organize all accommodation, transport in India and other bookings related to the tour.

Please ensure that you have a passport with a valid Indian visa.

For more information visit our website.

Please contact Keshava at keshavajenkins@gmail.com for more information or to join the 2022 tour!

eventname: Trip to Kaas - Maharashtra’s Valley of flowers
description:
Batches: 16th Sept; 23rd Sept (Friday nights)

The Kaas Plateau where hundreds of varieties of wild flowers of all colors bloom every year is situated approx. 25 Km from Satara city. More than 300 varieties of wild flowers, herbs, orchids, shrubs, insectivorous plants etc. can be seen here after monsoon.
This plateau overlooks the lush evergreen forests that serves as a water catchment area of Koyna Dam and a Tiger reserve. It is a dream destination not only for avid botanists but also for those who appreciate nature. Kaas plateau and the surrounding area has a very good birdlife with good sightings of Crested Buntings, Malabar Crested Larks, Oriental White-eyes, and Bonelli’s Eagle.


Itinerary:
Friday, 
20:00 - Pickup from Andheri, JVLR, Thane and Navi Mumbai in an AC bus

Saturday, 
05:00 - Reach Satara. Have breakfast and tea
07:00 - Explore the Kaas plateau, Kaas lake etc.
10:30 - We will visit either Bhambavali (Vajrai) waterfall
13:00 - Lunch break
15:00 - Start traveling back to Mumbai
22:00 - Reach Andheri


Fees: Rs.2499 
 - To be paid in advance for registration
 - Half non-refundable if canceled at least 48 hours before the trip
 - Non-refundable for cancellation within 48 hours before the trip
 - No discounts

Includes:
 - Travel from Mumbai to Kaas and back in a private AC bus
 - Breakfast and Tea
 - Vegetarian Lunch 
 - Entry fees at Kaas
 - Entry fees at Vajrai

Excludes:
 - Bottled water, cold drinks etc.
 - Anything not mentioned in ‘includes’

October 22 - November 4
(12 nights in India)

? After three successful retreats in India, I am happy to announce the 4th yoga retreat in India after two long pandemic years. The restrictions have loosened, it is the perfect time to explore places you haven't been to, inside and outside. 

What shall you read below:

⏩ Introduction
⏩ About Rishikesh
⏩ Why October
⏩ The Retreat Schedule & Activities
⏩ The Cost
⏩ What is Included
⏩ What is not-included
⏩ How to Register
⏩ Refund Policy
⏩ Flights and Visas
⏩ Covid Instructions

? Introduction: 

India is the birthplace of yoga. The first mention of yoga can be found in one of the ancient Sanskrit scriptures, Rig Veda which is considered  up to 10,000 years old. Some consider it timeless as are its teachings. 

All yogic aspirants and enthusiasts must go to India to touch the roots of this ancient practice and learn very many things about it that is impossible to learn and feel from a faraway western country. 

For this purpose and for the natural sceneries, hospitable people, and ancient cultures and traditions, I have organised another yoga retreat in India. 

We will spend 12 nights in Rishikesh, one of the oldest yogic towns in the world, at the foothills of the mighty Himalayas, by the sacred Ganges river and explore yoga, its many aspects and feel its teachings in the lives of local inhabitants. 

We will practice asana, pranayama, meditation in the banks of the river, surrounded by the Himalayan mountains. 

We will visit temples, ashrams, caves, waterfalls.

We will do a sunrise trek and meditate with the setting sun sitting by the river. 

We will learn basics of Ayurveda, receive an Ayurvedic consultation by a local physician, and receive a rejuvenating Ayurvedic massage. 

We will experience local customs such as Ganga Aarti, where the whole town is lit-up during the sunset and Lord Shiva and river Ganga is worshipped with devotional chanting and music. 

Since, our arrival is one-day prior to one of the biggest Indian festivals, Diwali, we will start off the retreat by experiencing the whole town ready to celebrate and we will celebrate with them. 

?

? About Rishikesh: 

Within India, Rishikesh is considered the birthplace of yoga and calls itself, 'The World Capital of Yoga' and rightly so. The town is home to many yogis today and has been a home to some of the greatest yogis India has witnessed. The town is full of Ashrams established by yogis and now by more modern ashrams established by today's yogis. Wherever you look, you find a yoga centre. The place is a high vibrating field of sacred energy. 
Besides, Rishikesh is extremely picturesque. People are warm and hospitable, food is delicious, weather is pleasant. And besides yoga, one can do adventure activities such as river rafting and bungee jumping. There are many short and long hikes that start from Rishikesh and the town also serves as the entry town to explore higher Himalayan regions. 

?

? Why October: 

Not too hot, not too cold, the river turns turquoise and transparent. Sky is clearer. It is so serene and pristine that it is the best time to visit.
Besides, this year, the festival of Diwali falls at the end of October which makes it an even better time to visit. 

?

? The Retreat Schedule: 

Mornings will be spent meditating and practicing asanas and pranyamas. 

Afternoons will be spent exploring Rishikesh and surrounding areas.

Evenings will be spent meditating, discussing yoga philosophies, engaging with guest teachers and learning various other aspects of Yoga. 

Late Evenings will be spent journalling, sharing, and doing moving meditations. 

?

? Activities: 

?Daily Asana and Pranayama Classes
?Meditation Practices
?Sound Healing Sessions
?Satsanga (Spiritual Discourses)
?Ayurvedic Consultation
?Ayurvedic Massage
?Visiting temples, ashrams, caves, waterfalls.
?Sunrise trek and other hikes
?Evening Ganga Aartis
?Visiting Beatles Ashram (Yes, the Beatles lived in Rishikesh for 6 months in the late 60s)
?Learning from local yoga teachers

?

? The Cost: 

⏩ 12 nights in Double-sharing accommodation: 1550 euros

⏩ 12 nights in single-sharing accommodation: 1950 euros 

Total Spots for the Retreat: 16

?

? What is Included: 

⏩All the activities mentioned in the 'Activites' section
⏩Accommodation for all 12 nights
⏩Breakfast and Dinner for entire duration
⏩Local Transport
⏩Local entrance tickets, wherever applicable



? What isn't Included:

⏩Flight tickets & Visa
⏩Any personal shoppings and trips
⏩Lunch isn't included (since meal sizes are usually bigger and many people prefer to eat twice a day only, the third meal isn't included but can be made available upon request)

?

? How to Register: 

? : yogaretreatswithhitesh@gmail.com
or
yogawithhitesh@gmail.com

?: +40-745172780

? To book your spot: 

⏩Please send an advance payment of 500 euros to book your spot. 
⏩The advance is 100% refundable if cancelled 60 days before the trip. 
⏩The advance is 50% refundable if cancelled between 30-60 days before the trip.
⏩The Advance is non-refundable if cancelled less than 30 days before the trip. 

?

? Flights and Visas:

We can all book the same fights and travel together or you can use this route and plan your travel accordingly.
We fly on October 22 from Bucharest to New Delhi. Then we fly from New Delhi to Dehradun. 

We will fly back on 4th November. Dehradun (DED) to New Delhi. New Delhi (DEL) to Bucharest (OTP).

From Dehradun airpot: The retreat centre is 15km away and we will use shuttle or cabs from the airport to Rishikesh. 

We can plan the travel on our private WhatsApp group. 

? Visas: 

The government of India provides e-Visa which is valid for one month. Visa can be applied from this website: https://indianvisaonline.gov.in/evisa/tvoa.html
Please make sure to use this website only. Beware of scams and frauds.

?

? Covid Instructions: 

Vaccine certificate or negative PCR test. 
For more details, stay connected to: 

https://www.newdelhiairport.in/airsuvidha/apho-registration

?

Looking forward to a memorable time in India, together.

Namaste ??

*Kuduremukha on 25th & 26th June   2022*

*ಕುದುರೆಮುಖ ಚಾರಣ*

About Kuduremukha;

Kudremukh literally means horse’s face in Kannada. This name is because of the distinctive shape of the peak. This is also called as Samseparvath historically as it used to access from Samse village.

Kudremukh is nestled in the heart of the western ghats in Chikkamagaluru district. It comes under Kudremukh National Park which is the second-largest wildlife protected area in the western ghats. 

It is situated at an altitude of 6,207 ft and is the 3rd highest peak of Karnataka after Mullayyangiri and Baba Budangiri.

Kudremukh is a home for many flora and fauna. You can even spot deer and peacocks on the way amongst other wildlife while trekking!  

It is a beautiful trek across the rolling green hills and misty valleys. You traverse through grasslands, forest and many small streams.


This is the best season to experience beautiful GREEN CARPET MOUNTAINS.


 SUMMARY:
Nature of the event : Trekking/Photography
Duration  :   2 Days
Difficulty Level  :   Moderate 
Trek distance: Around 22
Transportation : TT
Food  :  Home (Food will be arranged in the homestay)

 wHO CAN JOIN:

2. We will sleep in the home or tents in the home stay campus and participants has to get sleeping bags (Blankets will be provided, so if u wish to get your own sleeping bags/bed sheets u can get it)
4. We will keep all the luggage in the home and start the trek. Participants have to take only Water bottles, rain gears, torch and snacks, so please keep a small day bag for this  

ITINERARY : 

Day 1
Overnight Journey to Kudremukh | Begin with the Trek
On Friday, Get picked up in Bangalore from the following points and start your Kudremukh trekking tour:
Mejasitc at 9:00 PM
Yeshwantpur at 9:30 PM
Goraguntepalya at 10:00PM
Begin your overnight journey to Kudermukh.
On the first day of your Kudremukh trek, you will reach Kudremukh National Park around 06:00 AM.
After having breakfast, we will reach the base camp.
By 09:00 AM, we will start trekking to the top of Kudremukh Peak which is around 22 KM both the ways.
En route to the peak, have lunch in the midway.
Once we reach the top, all of us can enjoy the relishing view of the serenity the peak has to offer.
Return to the base camp around 06:00 PM after a trek to Kudremukh.
Enjoy the bonfire.
Have the lip-smacking dinner and retire for the night.

Enjoy the mesmerizing beauty of the waterfall and calm your soul.

eventname: Trek To Paithalmala hill & Explore Ezharakund Waterfalls @ 4900
description:
Trek To Paithalmala hill & Explore Ezharakund Waterfalls @ 4900

Dates :- 25 & 26 June - 2022
Trek fee :- INR 4900/Person
Contact :- 9686633699 / 7975053556
Registration Link : http://bit.ly/Paithalmalatrek

Overview 
===========
Paithalmala hill station tucked in the forest of Kodagu in the Kannur district of Kerala, Paithalmala is one of the most beautiful peaks in the Western Ghats that mesmerizes anyone who has been here. Standing tall at 4500 ft, Paithalmala is the tallest peak in the district of Kannur and a very popular trekking destination for all the nature and adventure lovers out there. An enchanting hill station with captivating beauty, thrilling trekking trails and abundance of lush greenery - Paithalmala is a perfect getaway.

Trekking is the best activity one can indulge in here, allowing you to absorb and be mesmerized by the stunning beauty of the place and its surroundings. A 6 km long trek from the base to the top of the hill takes you through dense forests and grasslands, ultimately leading to a watch tower at the top. The watch tower is the highlight of the whole trek as one get to see breathtaking scenery of the Kodagu forests, Coorg Forests and the adjoining areas. Small detours to the nearby ponds or lakes located via the help of the local people can add to your experience of Paithalmala.

===================
What you Expect from the Trip
=> Paithalmala hill 
=> Ezharakund Waterfalls
=> Dense Forest & Grass lands
=> Beauty of Kerala
=> Campfire - Green Valley 
=> Beautiful Views 

Brief Itinerary
---------------------------------
Day 0

--------------------------------
Day 1

• Saturday morning reach to Resort, fresh up and have breakfast 
• Trekking start to Paithalmala hill 
• Reach to peak - Take snaps - Have packed lunch- Descend 
• Back to Homestay & Take dip in Swimming pool (if time permits will visit unknown water falls)
• Have Tea & Snacjs
• Campfire - Kerala style Dinner - Games & Sleep

==============
Day 2
• Fresh up - Have & Breakfast 
• Visit to Ezharakund Waterfalls - play on water with Life Jackets  - Back to stay
• Checkout Homestay
• Journey towards kushalnagar (If time permits will go for Sightseeing)
• Start journey towards Bangalore  (Lunch on the way)
• Reach to Bangalore (9 PM)

description:
I.N.S.P.I.R.E. 2022 is the 2nd Edition of the International Summit for Planning and Incubating reforms in Education. This time the Summit is going to be held in Sonipat in association with the most Prestigious Rishihood University.
The Theme of I.N.S.P.I.R.E. 2022 is “THE FLIGHT OF THE PHOENIX- REVIVAL, RESURRECTION   and RE- CREATION of Education post Epidemic.”
We all are aware that post 2020 the education and  the whole world came to a forced stand still. The fear of the unknown engulfed the human race and grossly impacted the physical and mental being of all. Lifestyle changed overnight and humans imperatively boarded the rescue flight of survival .Similarly education after a big jolt suddenly changed its form, and as a shapeshifter it broke all the barriers and galloped forward.
When all thought there was no way ahead, Human intelligence in tandem with Technology, Artificial intelligence and Virtual reality rose like a PHOENIX from the ashes and boarded its flight towards an emerging era of a new way of learning.
This is one flight that shouldn’t be missed because if it happens so those left behind will be under the radar of being extinct as many others who didn’t change with the only constant i.e . CHANGE.
 
The conference will have eminent Eduleaders, Eduspeakers and Eduspirers who will share their Thoughts to solidify the thought and also take this flight to new horizons and dimensions.
They will be bringing new perspectives on
1. Inclusion- Addressing the Unconscious bias in Education
2. The Trinity intelligence: Artificial, Augmented & Human
3. Art based therapies- the professional touch and beyond the literal
4.The Future of Education- A paradigm shift
5. Edu Warriors- the Evolvers in the changing world
6. Homeschooling-The new normal and an alternative to the regular
7. The Impact of Social Media-  Building the Bridges of Communication for a better world.
8. SDGs 2030- journey towards  a happier healthier wholesome world
9.  Neuroscience -The brain Science transforming the learning
10. Global Citizenship- The potential of Civic Education, Cultural Diversity & Care of Planet Earth
11.Global Competencies - The Shifting dynamics of Educational Planning
12. Metaverse & Emerging Technologies- Preparing Educators for the impact
13. Creating Learning Communities - Connecting Families & Societies across the globe
14. Differential Learning - Personalized & Self-paved Learning
15. Literacies that Matter- Financial & Entrepreneurship
16. The Focus Shift- Skills for Life-  Self-Awareness ,Social Awareness ,Global Awareness

Event Name: Dudhsagar Waterfall trek
Batch 1: 2nd - 4th July 2022
Price Rs 3149/- per person (Mumbai - Mumbai)
Location: Goa
Type: Trail
Grade: Medium

About:
Dudhsagar Waterfalls- springing from a lofty height of 600m is located on the Goa-Karnataka border. It lies at a distance of 60 km from Panaji and 10 km from Colem Railway Station. Dudhsagar Falls (literally Sea of Milk ) is a tiered waterfall located on the Mandovi River in the Indian state of Goa on Goa's border with Karnataka state. It is four-tiered.

Dudhsagar is one of the world's most exquisite falls. It lies high up in the Mandovi River's watershed and so is not particularly spectacular during the dry season. During the monsoon season, however, the falls are transformed into one of the most powerful falls in India. 
Dudhsagar Falls is listed as India's fifth tallest waterfall and is 227th in the world at 310 m. The water plummets hundreds of meters (over a thousand feet) in large volumes during the rainy monsoon season, forming one of the most spectacular natural phenomena in Goa. It is a major part of the Goa ecosystem. It is a four-tiered waterfall with a total height of 310 meters (1017 feet) and an average width of 30 meters (100 feet)

One has to get down at Kulem (Collem) railway station and walk towards the falls which are about 11 km away. It normally takes 2–3 hours to reach. The famous photograph of Trains passing through before the waterfalls can be seen in this route and also the complete stretch of the falls will be visible while you hike towards the waterfalls.

Itinerary:
Dudhsagar waterfall Trek Itinerary

Day 1:
4:00 pm Meet Adventure Geek Leader at LTT. We will be catching 22113 LTT KVCL Super Fast Express which leaves at 4.55 pm.
08:00 pm Dinner time (Bring your Own Dinner)
Will be having a few games too while traveling.
10:00 pm Good Night!!!
Day 2:

04:00 am - Reach Madgaon station, will be going Kulem by Pvt Vehicle.
05:30 am - Reach Kulem, Freshen up, breakfast time, and gear up for the Trek.
06:00 am - Introduction round and start trekking towards the Dudhsagar Waterfall (14 Km) by track route
09:30 am - Reach Dudhsagar Base Waterfall and enjoy the scenic view of the waterfalls and the journey too.
11:30 am - Start Return Journey towards starting point.
03:00 pm - Reach Base Point, Freshen up and have lunch.

Devkund Waterfall Trek
Devkund Waterfall is a serene lace located at the end of Plus valley. A small lake is created due to a 300 ft falling waterfall is known as the Devkund waterfall. Located near Bhira, it is a small hike and any newbie can join. As the name suggests Devkund is a place of local villagers’ faith and they regard this as the origin of Kundalika River.
So what are you waiting for? Join in for this easy graded to Devkund waterfall trek

We organize the Devkund waterfall trek from Mumbai and Pune as well.

Highlights:-
Magnificent Waterfalls
Waterfall Trek
Play around the natural pool formed under the waterfalls
Crossing over the famous Tamhini Ghat
Clear bluish-green water body
Dense trails filled with flora and fauna
Fun-filled and exhilarating trekking experience

01:30 pm: Reach the base village

07:30 pm: Reach Mumbai

eventname: Paw Patrol The Mighty Movie.Release Date 13 October 2023.

description:
One of the oldest civilisations in the world, India is a mosaic of multicultural experiences. With a rich heritage and myriad attractions, the country is among the most popular tourist destinations in the world. It covers an area of 32, 87,263 sq. km, extending from the snow-covered Himalayan heights to the tropical rain forests of the south. As the 7th largest country in the world, India stands apart from the rest of Asia, marked off as it is by mountains and the sea, which give the country a distinct geographical entity.

Fringed by the Great Himalayas in the north, it stretches southwards and at the Tropic of Cancer, tapers off into the Indian Ocean between the Bay of Bengal on the east and the Arabian Sea on the west. As you travel the expanse of the country, you are greeted by diverse nuances of cuisines, faiths, arts, crafts, music, nature, lands, tribes, history and adventure sports. India has a mesmeric conflation of the old and the new. As the bustling old bazaars rub shoulders with swanky shopping malls, and majestic monuments accompany luxurious heritage hotels, the quintessential traveller can get the best of both worlds. Head to the mountains, enjoy a beach retreat or cruise through the golden Thar, India has options galore for all.    दुनिया की सबसे पुरानी सभ्यताओं में से एक, भारत बहुसांस्कृतिक अनुभवों की पच्चीकारी है। समृद्ध विरासत और असंख्य आकर्षणों के साथ, देश दुनिया के सबसे लोकप्रिय पर्यटन स्थलों में से एक है। यह 32,87,263 वर्ग किमी के क्षेत्र को कवर करता है, जो बर्फ से ढकी हिमालय की ऊंचाइयों से दक्षिण के उष्णकटिबंधीय वर्षा वनों तक फैला हुआ है। दुनिया के 7वें सबसे बड़े देश के रूप में, भारत एशिया के बाकी हिस्सों से अलग खड़ा है, क्योंकि यह पहाड़ों और समुद्र से अलग है, जो देश को एक अलग भौगोलिक इकाई देता है।

उत्तर में महान हिमालय से घिरा, यह दक्षिण की ओर फैला है और कर्क रेखा पर, पूर्व में बंगाल की खाड़ी और पश्चिम में अरब सागर के बीच हिंद महासागर में गिर जाता है। जैसे ही आप देश के विस्तार की यात्रा करते हैं, आपको व्यंजनों, विश्वासों, कला, शिल्प, संगीत, प्रकृति, भूमि, जनजाति, इतिहास और साहसिक खेलों की विविध बारीकियों का स्वागत किया जाता है। भारत में पुराने और नए का सम्मोहक संगम है। जैसे-जैसे चहल-पहल वाले पुराने बाज़ारों में आलीशान शॉपिंग मॉल और आलीशान विरासती होटलों के साथ राजसी स्मारक होते हैं, सर्वोत्कृष्ट यात्री दोनों दुनिया का सबसे अच्छा अनुभव प्राप्त कर सकते हैं। पहाड़ों पर जाएं, सुनहरी थार के माध्यम से समुद्र तट पर वापसी या क्रूज का आनंद लें, भारत में सभी के लिए ढेर सारे विकल्प हैं।

eventname: Vir Das in GUWAHATI! | WANTED TOUR INDIA
description:
India’s highest selling English stand-up comedian Vir Das, is bringing his brand new show THE WANTED TOUR to GUWAHATI for the FIRST TIME EVER!

Watch him live at PRAGJYOTI ITA CENTER on 26th June, 8pm onwards.

Tickets: https://bit.ly/Wanted-Guwahati

About the tour

The tour has travelled across 15 cities with 20 shows and has received rave reviews.

'He put the mic down and walked off to a standing ovation.' - Washington Post

'There is a mixture of audacity and humility in Das’s comedy, He seems to have arrived at this new stage fully formed.' - Boston Globe

'We should take this comedian seriously.' - Decider

'Das Could be persecuted, but he won’t stop' - Variety Comedy Impact 2021

'Breaks the rules. It’s also SO funny' - Vulture

'No artist embodies the globalisation of stand-up like Vir Das' - New York Times

Free Weekend Class. Apply Here: https://forms.gle/byswY2JYLyGfqc22A

This training program provides an introduction to Pranahuti Supported Meditation (PSM).
This spiritual practice brings balanced living. It enables one to realize one’s inner potential. Pranahuti (Yogic Transmission) by a competent trainer helps one transform and grow in consciousness in a practical manner.
This workshop contains 2-4 experiential guided meditations, and covers the topics of methods of meditation, holistic way of living, control of mind and concentration, Yogic transmission (Pranahuti), and stages of progress.

* Cost for this class and all future support is free.

eventname: IASH Adv Level 1 Sound healing and Training Workshop with Singing Bowls, Ahmedabad, INDIA
description:
Learn the Art & Science of Sound Healing to achieve the real goals of your life, Good Health, Better relationship, Peace, Prosperity and spirituality in an Internationally Acclaimed, Advanced level 1 Sound Healing & Training Workshop being offered by ” Academy of Sound Healing ” worldwide, with tremendous success and global recognition. This Seminar will make you competent & qualified enough to apply advanced Sound healing techniques with Singing Bowls to help your family, friends with their physical & emotional distress as well as work professionally to heal & help people around you.


This workshop offers students maximum knowledge within a limited time frame & with minimum expenses.

Workshop participants will leave this workshop proficient in the use and treatment with Singing Bowls & will be able to integrate this valuable skill the very next day in their personal & professional healing work, deep yoga & meditation practice, self healing , spiritual journey & to alter their consciousness for a greater peace & happiness in life

eventname: DPC Roadtrip to Ladakh and Hemis Festival
description:
DPC announces the most awaited Photo trip of the year: Photo Bus to Ladakh.

A truly unforgettable experience to capture the most beautiful landscapes, monasteries, and people. 
So please find a detailed itinerary for the photo capture trip. 

-Date of Journey:  01st July to 11th July
-Meeting Place: IIT Delhi, the main gate 
-Timings: 4.30 pm (pls be there 20 mins before departure)

Itinerary for the Leh Trip July 2022

01st July: DAY 0: Delhi to Jammu/Srinagar

02nd July: DAY 1: Srinagar (stay in Hotel)

03rd July: DAY 2: Srinagar  to Kargil Night halt at Kargil

04th July   : DAY 3: Kargil to Leh

05th July: Day 4: Acclimatization at Leh(Visit Shanti Stupa & Leh Palace)

06th July: DAY 5: Nubra valley.   Diskit Monastery

07th July   : DAY 6: Nubra valley to Pangong Tso to Leh via seyok river

08th July   : DAY 7: Pangong Tso to Leh Via Hemis Monastery

09th July: DAY 8: Visiting Hemis Monastery and Start Back from Leh to Keylong via Sarchu and Night Halt at Keylong

10th July: DAY 9: Keylong to Rohtang Pass  or Atal Tunnel - Manali  to Delhi

11th July: DAY 10: Delhi 

 
-Fee (per person): Rs. 42,000/- (including everything - need not pay even for water bottle)

For Members: Rs. 40,000/- 
The fee includes travel & group transfers, stay, and meals 

For further clarifications feel free to call Virendra - 08826712162

eventname: Walks around Esplanade - the many versions of Calcutta
description:
Walks around Esplanade - the many versions of Calcutta
Sunday, July 10th, 2022 
7:45am to 10am

Starting point : Metropolitan Building, the majestic building (picture of the building in our banner of this event) at the corner of SN Banerjee Road crossing with JN Road. 

Winston Churchill famously said, history is written by the victors. On the other hand, the American author Robert Fulghum said, \I believe imagination is stronger than knowledge
banner_url: that myth is more potent than history\". The city of Calcutta's history was first written by its founders

Medicall, is India’s largest B2B Medical Equipment Exhibition is organized by Medexpert Business Consultants Pvt Ltd, promoted by Dr. Manivannan S, Managing Director of Kauvery hospital a 1200 bedded Hospital group in South India.

This hospital was started 19 years back with 30 beds by young professionals with limited knowledge about hospital industry. They faced many hurdles in their course of growth. Medicall was born with the idea to share their expertise with the fellow medical fraternity.

Early in his career, he identified that nursing homes, small hospitals and clinics in tier 2 and 3 cities faced a distinct disadvantage in the market while procuring hospital equipment or service. They neither had the choice nor the price advantage enjoyed by the biggies.

While talking about the motivation behind starting this expo, Dr Manivannan S says, \Small and medium sized hospital owners from tier II and III cities cannot afford to have qualified purchase managers. Equipment companies also do not have adequate sale force to meet all these hospital owners. Since I have undergone the difficulty for my hospital
banner_url: I thought Medicall will bring in all equipment manufacturers under one roof.\"

event_id: Medicall serves as a marketing platform wherein the equipment companies showcase their products and services to Hospital owners and decision makers.
Since MEDICALL is being organized by people who have been in Healthcare field for many years
eventname: the content and the quality of the visitors are expected to be better than any other previously held event."
timezone: nonprofit,business,exhibitions,workshops

गिरनार परिक्रमा, गुरुशिखर आणि द्वारका....
 
 ३ नोव्हेंबर ते ९ नोव्हेंबर २०२२ 

सौराष्ट्रातील जुनागढ जवळचे गिरनार हे स्थान दत्त उपासनेचे एक प्राचीन केंद्र आहे. अशा ह्या पवित्र गिरनार पर्वताच्या परिक्रमेलाही विशेष महत्व आहे. गिरनार परिक्रमा करण्यासाठी वनविभाग वर्षातून एकदाच परवानगी देते. कार्तिक एकादशी ते कार्तिक पौर्णिमा या पाच दिवसात हि परिक्रमा केली जाते. ह्या दरम्यान देवी-देवता , ऋषीमुनी , गंधर्व अप्सरा हे सर्व जण पृथ्वीवर येऊन हि परिक्रमा करतात असे मानले जाते. लाखोंच्या संख्येने भाविक ही परिक्रमा करण्यासाठी येत असतात.
36 किमीची हि परिक्रमा करताना अनेकांना दैवी अनुभव येतात. आत्तापर्यंत जवळपास 1500 हुन अधिक दत्तभक्तांना दर्शन घडवून आणण्यात दत्तमहाराजांच्या कृपेने दुर्गमल्हारला यश आले आहे. दरसाल प्रमाणे यंदाही गिरनार परिक्रमेचे आयोजन आपण करत आहोत. परिक्रमेसोबत आपण गुरुशिखर, द्वारका, बेट द्वारका आणि नागेश्वर (12 ज्योतिर्लिंगांपैकी एक) सुद्धा करणार आहोत.

 पर्याय 1. परिक्रमा, द्वारका आणि पौर्णिमेला गुरुशिखर.

 पर्याय 2. गिरनार परिक्रमा व गुरुशिखर.

३) आश्रमामध्ये 5 जणांमध्ये एक एसी रूम

eventname: Trek To Valley Of Flower & Trip To Badrinath - Mana Village @ 10750
description:
Trek To Valley Of Flower & Trip To Badrinath - Mana Village @ 10750
Batch-1 : 18 July To 23 July 2022 (6 Days)
Batch-2 : 20 August To 25 August 2022 (6 Days)
Cost : INR 10750/Person (Including all Rishikesh to Rishikesh)
Registration Link : https://bit.ly/Valleyofflowertrek2022

*Overview*
===========
Valley of flowers National Park is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, situated at an altitude of 3352 to 3658 meters above sea level, located in Uttarakhand State known for its most captivating meadows and endemic species of Alpine flowers. The park, open from June to September, offers a fantastic panoramic view with a vibrant green background, landscapes, skylines and cascading waterfalls. The clouds, the high-altitude mountains and abundant waterfalls make this place a perfect go. As the clouds start coming down, you can barely see the enormous glacier to the right of and below. While you could spot a lot of familiar flowers, you will also witness some never before seen varieties of alpine flowers. For most of the year, the valley lies coated under layers of snow with beautiful and rare flowers everywhere. The beauty of the \Valley of Flowers National Park\" and \"Shri Hemkund Sahib\" cannot be expressed in words and hence we recommend this at least once in a lifetime experience.

description:
В этот раз наш путь будет  лежать в Гималаи, в одно из важных мест паломничества, священное место, так называемую-Чар-дхаму (четыре святых места –Ямунтори, Ганготри, Кедарнатх и Бадринатх)три из которых мы посетим. Каждый индуист обязательно должен за свою жизнь побывать здесь. 

Гималаи-это святая святых нашей планеты, это живая история, окутанная тайнами. Но это не только легенды, Гималаи мощнейший ретранслятор космической энергии и тех знаний, что несут нам Духовные Учителя человечества и одно прибывание в этих местах приводит к серьёзной трансформации. Они обладают мистической силой, эти места идеальны для духовных практик и медитаций. Мы с вами отправимся в самое сердце Гималаев. http://travel-to-shambala.com/himalayas

About the Course and who can join

The 6-months photography course is to develop and nurture the basic and advance understanding of photography to the enrolled participants, how a photograph is made rather than just a click.

The course is developed in DPC with the experience of the last 7 years in the field of photography, after meeting and talking with lots of professional, amateurs photographers, and people from different walks of life and conducting more than 200+ workshops, 400+ photowalks, 65+ Photo Bus Trips, Over 20 Photography exhibitions, and many tea talks.

The 6-month course at DPC is seeking participants who want to take photography as their profession. The minimum qualification for this course is 12+ PASS or equivalent course. It's a full-time course.
Classes will be on weekdays 3 classes every week.

MODULE 1
-History of photography
-Functions of the camera
-What is exposure and its use
-Difference between film and digital
-Composition techniques and their importance
-Masters work and how it is important in present photography

MODULE 2
-How to understand natural light
-Techniques of Black and white photography
-Techniques of Color Photography
-Understanding street photography
-Breaking the ice in street photography
-In-depth knowledge of street photography
-Technique of using flash in indoor and outdoor
-How to understand good photography and selection of photos

MODULE 3
-Introduction to portrait photography
-Lighting technique for portrait
-Understand the studio and its layout
-Studio lighting
-Portrait in studio
-Behavior of flash in studio lighting
-Process and develop RAW files
-In-depth understand of editing software
-The difference between digital files and print
-Printing photographs and their importance

MODULE 4
-Business and market of photography
Developing portfolio

FAQ’s

Zapraszamy na wyjazd do Rajasthanu w czasie Festiwalu Pustynnego w Jaisalmer, do którego zjeżdżają się muzycy z całej okolicy. Rajasthan, czyli kraina maharadżów słynie z licznych fortów, ale także z rękodzieła i folkloru. 

Podczas tej wycieczki zwiedzimy stolicę Indii - Delhi oraz majestatyczny Taj Mahal. Następnie rozpoczniemy trasę wgłąb Pustyni Thar, poprzez Jaipur, Pushkar i Jodhpur do Jaisalmeru. Po Festiwalu wrócimy przez Bikaner i Mandawę. Jeśli nazwy te nie mówią wiele, zaufaj nam. Napisz do nas, otrzymasz szczegółowy program i wytyczne, jak się przygotować.

Wyjazd ten jest organizowany dla koneserów sztuki, dlatego planowany jest dodatkowo warsztat tańca cyganek Kalbelia, dla zainteresowanych. Oprócz Festiwalu Pustynnego nie odpuścimy żadnej okazji, by zobaczyć radżasthański folklor. Będzie sporo czasu na buszowanie po bazarach, bo najlepsze zakupy robi się tutaj. Jeśli nie wiesz wiele o sztuce Indii, nie obawiaj się dołączyć do nas dla świetnej zabawy.

Pilotką na tej trasie będzie Anita Singh, specjalizująca się w kulturze i tradycjach Indii, tancerka, mówiąca w hindi, doświadczona pilotka.

eventname: Culinary Tour to the Yucatan (Isla Mujeres and Valladolid)
description:
This 5-night 6-day journey to the heart of Mayan country is an incredible, fun-filled experience. We spend most of our days and nights enjoying the island of isla Mujeres, a beautiful small island that is easy to get around! Enjoy beach days, curated experiences and luxurious accommodations. We take one day trip to Valladolid to immerse ourselves in food, cenotes and the rich culinary and cultural history of the area. All excursions are designed especially for our group. ONLY 8 SPOTS!

Highlights include:
* lodging at the beautiful Isla retreats, an oasis on the island
* cooking class with Award winning chef 
* guided mezcal and tequila tasting experience
* day trip to Valladolid for ruins, cenotes and a market tour
* time for beach and sunsets

eventname: Most Welcome our community Bold & Beautiful
description:
ROMAN CLUB एकल यात्रियों के लिए एकदम सही है, जो भारत में समान यात्रा कार्यक्रम वाले समान विचारधारा वाले यात्रियों से मिलना चाहते हैं। हमारे पास एक 3-चरणीय सत्यापन प्रक्रिया है जिसमें सोशल मीडिया, फोन नंबर और वैध सरकारी आईडी शामिल है, ताकि आप अपने संभावित ट्रैवल पार्टनर के बारे में सुरक्षित महसूस कर सकें। 170 से अधिक देशों के उपयोगकर्ताओं के साथ, आप कनेक्ट कर सकते हैं, चैट कर सकते हैं और सही यात्रा मित्र ढूंढ सकते हैं, भारत में मिल सकते हैं और एक साथ यात्रा कर सकते हैं।                                 यात्रा भागीदार खोजें

यात्राओं, स्थानीय लोगों और उपयोगकर्ताओं की सूची ब्राउज़ करें जो वर्तमान में भारत में हैं।            जुड़ा हो

जब आप भारत में किसी ऐसे व्यक्ति को ढूंढते हैं जिससे आप मिलना चाहते हैं, तो बस कनेक्ट को हिट करें और उनके साथ चैट करना शुरू करें।          एक साथ यात्रा

एक साथ योजना बनाएं, भारत में अपने यात्रा साथी के साथ पूर्व-निर्धारित सार्वजनिक स्थान पर मिलें और एक साथ यात्रा करें।                                     भारत में यात्रियों के साथ जुड़ें

eventname: CHENNAI AUDITION | MISS SUPER MODEL GLOBE, INDIA 2022, SEASON 3!
description:
CHENNAI GET READY FOR MISS SUPER MODEL GLOBE, INDIA 2022, SEASON 3! 
Audition Date – 30 July 2022

Register Yourself through https://www.supermodelglobe.com/register.html

The Miss Supermodel Globe is a great means of learning competitiveness, building self-confidence, exercising self-discipline, and winning or losing with grace. It’s a platform which offers competitors tools that they can take with them into their next competition or life experience where they might be pitted against someone else.

Opportunity to Be a Part of
Second Most Prestigious Beauty Pageant Of India


MISS SUPERMODEL GLOBE, INDIA 2022, SEASON 3 is about more than learning from one another. It creates a learning opportunity for each and every contestant in the competition itself.  The contestants will be able to learn much about poise, etiquette, and how to present themselves under pressure.  Don’t miss out on this golden chance. Participate now!

CELEBRITY OF THE MAIN EVENT - URVASHI RAUTELA (Indian Actress, Miss Diva Universe 2015)

For more info, visit us at - https://www.supermodelglobe.com/

eventname: Mega Green Vehicle & Smart Mobility Show, New Delhi
description: The Core Confluence of ACE Exhibitions - the leaders in Industrial Exhibitions & M7 Creations for Emerging Technology Shows and Conferences. AIm is to Support & Serve Advance Industrial Products, Services, Innovation and Technology through Mega Expositions

Andaman and Nicobar Islands are the heavenly archipelago of 572 islands known for clean beaches, turquoise waters and thrilling water sports.

Highlights:- 
 - Sunset at Radhanagar - regarded as best beach of India
 - Snorkeling (included in cost)
 - Scuba diving and sea walk (at own cost)
 - Sound and Light Show at Cellular Jail
 - Cruise from Port Blair to Havelock Island.
 - Elephant Beach – Hub for water sport
 - Neil Island’s Bharatpur beach, Sitapur Beach
 - Natural coral Bridge at Neil
 - Getaway to Corbyn’s Cove beach
 - Sunset from Chidiya Tapu


Trip Cost: 41,999 per person

Inclusion:  
 - Snorkeling activity
 - Travel expenses from Port Blair onwards for the whole trip
 - Accommodation expenses on double sharing basis
 - Meals (breakfast and dinner)
 - Entry charge at Cellular Jail and other places
 - Travel guidance and expertise

Exclusion:-
 - Basic fee does not include travel fare till Port Blair
 - Any exotic or expensive food, alcoholic drinks etc.
 - Any personal expenditure.
 - Any water sport not mentioned in inclusion
 - Any other place not mentioned in plan


Day 1: Port Blair
Arrive at Port Blair and check-in at the hotel.
Visit the National Monument, the Cellular Jail and explore the history and struggle of many freedom fighters. Later, head towards Corbyn Cove beach, a picturesque, coconut palm-fringed beach. In the evening, we will return to cellular jail to see the light and sound show.
 
Day2: Havelock Island
Travel to Havelock Island in the morning in a private cruise (2.5 hours) and enjoy the mesmerizing journey through the Bay of Bengal. In the afternoon, visit Radhanagar Beach which is termed as one of the best beaches in Asia.
Game-fishing, swimming, and snorkeling are other sports you can indulge till the beautiful sunset.
 
Day 3: Havelock Island
Head out to the Elephant Beach through an adventurous route i.e. 30 min jungle trek. The beach has white sand and fallen trees that are perfect for relaxing and photography. We can also do some watersports here

Day 4: Neil Island
Visit the beautiful Kalapathar Beach, famous for sunrise and pristine water in Havelock. Later, Cruise to Neil Island which is well known for its unexplored coral reefs, brilliant bio-diversity, white sandy beaches, and tropical forest and vegetation.
After check-in at the hotel, we will visit unspoiled white sandy beaches at Bharatpur and Sitapur.
 
Day 5: Neil Island
Morning will be leisure. We will see a natural coral bridge in the late afternoon. The coral bridges can be visited during low tide by walking.
In Evening, we will sit on Lakshmanpur beach. It offers one of the best sunsets in Andaman. Relax and enjoy the serene view of this little island
 
Day 6: Port Blair
Post breakfast, we will leave for Port Blair via cruise. If time permits then we will visit the Chidiya Tapu which is a nice place to watch the sunset. Trippers can also choose to explore Port Blair for shopping in the evening.

Day 7: Return
Check-out of the hotel and board the return flight with a plethora of memories

This exciting 12-day tour will take you to a destination that has attracted attention all over the world. Dubai is a breathtaking metropolis boasting distinctive modern architecture. Begin your journey by exploring the old and modern regions of this breathtaking cosmopolitan city. Discover the major city highlights with a tour of Dubai before you have dinner onboard an exquisitely decorated Dhow. Later, prepare for a thrilling journey over rolling dunes deep in the heart of the desert, where you will enjoy a BBQ dinner and traditional Belly dancing performance. Later your journey continues towards the Maldives. Explore the best side of Maldives and get ready to be enchanted by its beautiful islands on this vacation that includes a stay at Kurumba Maldives resort.
