How about exploring a city that never sleeps on wheels? If you love aamchi Mumbai and Midnight Cycling in Mumbai would be something you love, than Mumbai Midnight Cycling Coastal Route is for you. Under the indigo midnight sky when the hustle and bustle of the city comes to a halt and the city is breathing and enjoying it’s own sweet time, explore your home like never before. Fancy a cycle ride through the treasured heritage sites of Mumbai and have the experience of a lifetime, something that you will cherish for the rest of your lives. Let the sights and sounds of Ocean waves enthral you.  Breathe in the crisp, cool air as you pass by the coastal route of Mumbai and make it a part of your memories.

Every year countless choose to experience the mesmerizing sites while travelling from Manali to Leh by road. For most adventure enthusiast, the best way to cover this distance is on a bike as it offers them the thrill of a lifetime besides enabling them to enjoy some really unique sights.

 

There are several agencies offering services of bike rental in Manali for visitors. However, in order to enjoy a great trip, it is important for the bikers to keep the following factors in mind while renting a bike.

 

Rental Conditions : The bikers should make sure that they are well aware of the various conditions for bike hire established by the service providers. In general the agencies provide a copy of these conditions along with the rental agreement to the bikers to avoid any issues at a later stage.

 

Type Of Deals : In most cases the bikers will have to agree to a round trip, even if they do not plan to return the same way. However, some agencies will provide the facility of a one way trip making it possible for the bikers to surrender the vehicle in Leh.

 

Type Of Vehicle : While most riders opt to complete the journey on a bike, it is also possible for them to rent a scooter for local sightseeing or even the trip to Leh. They can even choose to rent a motorbike of a specific model and make if it is available with the rental service provider.

 

Rental Costs : The riders should seek information from multiple service providers about the cost of bike hiring before finalizing the best one. The rental costs will vary in accordance with the type of vehicle and deal chosen.

 

Basic Rental Facts: Before finalizing a rental service, it is important for the riders to check out their rental FAQ’s. These might include the details of how to rent a bike in Manali, cancelation and refund policies and various other important details.

Chembra peak stays pleasant and is worth visiting all around the year. The trek starts early in the mid morning and crossing the rugged, yet beautiful terrains, reach the top by late morning. Once you reach the top, the incredible views of the neighbouring hillocks are bound to take your heart away. Spend some time at the peak and enjoy the panoramic view of the entire Wayanad from the top. That quite a view, we assure.
 
Come, be a part of God own country and rejoice your soul with the gift of nature.
 
Difficulty level: Easy
 
Best Season: All round the year
 
Trek Length : 9Km
 
Tentative Itinerary :
 
Day 0
 
09:30 PM Start from Marathahalli, Bangalore
11:00 PM Reach RR Nagar, start 300km oneside journey, 7hrs approx
 
Day 1
 
06:00 AM Reach Waynad Homesaty, freshen up
08:30 AM Have breakfast & colect packed lunch. Travel to base, 25kms in a vehicle
10:00 AM Start trek 10km (up & down). Have lunch in between
03:30 PM Finish trek & start back to homestay
05:00 PM Reach homestay. Have tea snacks & relax
08:30 PM Have dinner & rest for the day
 
Day 2
 
06:30 AM Wake up & have bed cofee, freshen up
09:00 AM Have breakfast. Start to Meenmutty waterfalls , finish experience & depart to bangalore
01:00 PM Have self sponsored lunch (lunch not included in the package)
10:00 PM Reach Bangalore
 
 
Pickup Points:
 
1. Marathahalli (09:30 PM) - Near Kalamandir
2. Silk Board (10:00 PM) - Bus Stop, Opposite To Pizza Hut
3. BTM (10:10 PM) Udupi - Garden Bus Stop, Opposite To A2B
4. Banashankari (10:30 PM) - Bus Stop
5. RR Nagar (11:15 PM) - Gopalan Arcade, Mysore Road
 
Things To Carry:
 
Backpack
Rain coat/Poncho
2litre water bottle per person
Dry fruits, energy bar, chocolates, energy drink, Snacks etc.
Personal medication
Sweater/ jackets for the night
Extra pair of clothes
Toiletries (Tissue paper, Toilet paper, etc.)
Sports shoes or trekking shoes in good condition
Torch per person with extra batteries
Track pants and cotton T-shirt
Camera (optional)
Moov spray, dettol solution or salt to avoid leeches
Beutiful wildlife                                                      Pench national park turiya jungal.                  Safari . 8/12/ 21

Dare2Gear is back to redefine adventure with a platform to discover the real you and brings along an opportunity to come close with the best of nature. We are pleased to add one more adventure to your kitty by presenting Manali Leh + Khardungla cycling expeditions in the mountains. In this world. If anyone has a love for nature and is passionate about adventure then LEH is one of the must-have experiences listed in adventure diaries.

Manali - Khardungla Cycle Ride
This is the mecca of Mountain Rides in India and a veritable Bucket List Item for all Cycling Buff. One of India's best cycling routes in terms of natural beauty!

ITINERARY
Day 1: Arrive in Manali
Reach Manali and our ground team will coordinate with you and decide the meeting point.
Thereafter you are transferred to your hotel, where you meet up and acquainted with other fellow riders. After getting some rest and post Lunch, we head out for a short orientation/acclimatization ride. In the evening our team will brief you on things to keep in mind for the next 10 days expedition. We retire early, give our bodies a complete rest before the start of our expedition the next day.

Day 2: Manali to Marhi
Stay: Domes / Camping
Cycling: 35km
Altitude: 3320 Meters
After early morning breakfast, we will be Starting our Manali + Leh Khardung La cycle tour from the hotel itself. Hop on the bikes to begin this memorable journey riding through this valley laid with colorful flowers in the fields. The landscape it feels was specifically designed for an adventure-seeking cyclist. Riding through hairpin curves the road leads us to the small town of Marhi.

Day 3: Marhi to Keylong
Stay: Hotel
Cycling: 78km
Altitude: 3350
The day will begin with a climb of 12km to the Rohtang pass, at Rohtang snow-peaked glaciers await us in the line of the Horizon. After some relaxation at Rohtang, we descend towards the River Khoksar. After a while of easy riding, we cross Sissu at the foothills of the Pir Pinjal range. Later we encounter mountain streams flowing over the roads to Reach Keylong.

Day 4: Keylong to ZingZingBAr
Stay: Domes / Camping
Cycling: 48 km
Altitude: 3820 Meters
With an easy start of the day up to ZingZingBAr. Today a rusty rocky terrain awaits us as we pass the tiny hamlet town of Jispa. There is much descend before the climb towards Patseo. Also, today is the first time we experience complete Isolation from the outer world and low oxygen region. After reaching Patseo it is a gradual easy climb ride to ZingZingBAr. The day comes to an end as we make a touchdown in ZingZingBAr. Overnight stay after dinner.

Day 5: ZingZingBAr to Sarchu
Stay: Swiss Hut
Cycling: 58km
Altitude 4255 Meters
After an early morning bite, we gradually ascend towards the 2nd pass on this route Baralacha La, via Zing zing bar. Today we do our climb mostly on a tarmac surface, with less traffic. After crossing the Naughty Baralacha La, the entire topography of the region changes and we get the first glimpse of the Mountain Desert. Thereafter we descend down to Bharatpur and from there on taking the rolling terrain to Sarchu.

Day 6: Sarchu to Pang
Stay: Domes / Camp Pang
Cycling: 80 Km
Altitude 4370 Meter
Brace yourself for a challenging ride today, as we will cross two mountain passes in a day. From our campsite, it's a rolling terrain till the start of Gata Loops, from where we start climbing. After climbing up 22 Loops, we can take a breather with some rolling terrain for a few km, before we again ascend to 3rd Pass on this route NakeeLa.We will also be passing through the 'Lachlung La' pass today. The view en route is so mesmerizing that you hardly notice the hard work. From the pass, we will descend to Pang, and relax in the stay domes for the night.

Day 7: Pang to Debring
Stay: Camping
Cycling: 51km
Altitude: 4695
This morning only a 5 km climb and you will touch the most beautiful route of your journey called Morrie plains. Scenic beauty with the full metal and well-maintained roads. Today is the easiest day of riding where you will explore the completely different landscape. This region has a wide horizon where on your left and ride for approx 2 km you will find plains and then the huge multi-color mountains. This is the day when you will feel happy about overcoming all the challenges you overcome to be here to live this moment.

Day 8: Debring to Lato
Stay: Guest House
Cycling: 53km
Altitude 4835
Today's ride will take you to Taglangla pass after 2 Km of an easy ride. Taglangla is the second highest motorable road of this expedition and today it is going to be a tough climb day. As long roads and continuous climb of approx 15 km. Taglangla pass is 5328 meters from the sea makes way for a scenic descend towards Lato. Thereafter a zippy 35 km downhill awaits us, to reach our destination of the day Lato.

Day 9: Lato to Leh
Stay: Hotel
Cycling: 82km,
Altitude: 3600 Meters
We take it easy today and start at leisure. Along the River Indus, we ride from Lato/Upshi into the main town of Ladakh Leh. En route we would crossing and also visit few main monasteries of the region Hemis, Thiksey and Shey. We will reach Leh gate first to get our group picture click and then shall proceed to the hotel.

Day 10 :Leh to Khardungla
Stay: Hotel
Cycling: 80km
Altitude 5360 Meters
After an early breakfast, we leave for Khardungla pass, the world's highest mountain pass. You climb past Karakorum and Zaskar mountains to reach Khardungla. We cycle through the scenic valley on the world's highest motorable road to the top of this journey with a sense of achievement that has no parallel. Celebrate this moment of pride and success with your bike and your fellow riders. Ride back to our hotel in Leh for a dinner celebration and to rest for the night.

Day 11: Return Day
Today morning post breakfast you are free to plan your return. Few people take flight and return back. Few stay there to roam in and around Leh. So the call is completely yours if you need any assistance in planning we are there to help you out.

Inclusions:
 10 Breakfasts
 10 Lunches
 10 Dinners
 Hotel Stay
 Camp Stays
 Swiss Camp Stay
 2 Support Vehicles
 Ride Marshal
 Expedition Cycling Jersey
 Hydration & Nutrition Support

Exclusions:
 Anything which is not mentioned above.

eventname: Malda (Gour Adina Jagjivanpur) & Kulik Bird Sanctuary (Raiganj)
description:
Malda (Gour Adina Jagjivanpur) & Kulik Bird Sanctuary (Raiganj)

A wonderful time to explore the heritages of Bengal and also to go on bird watching trail of migratory birds before they leave. In Malda besides Gour and Adina we will also take you to Jagjivanpur for the excavated Buddhist site. In Raiganj, visit the Kulik bird sanctuary to catch a glimpse of the migratory birds. 

Departure Friday, Nov 25th, 2022 by morning train. AC Chair car.

description:
We are organizing “Aamchi Mumbai Cyclothon on 13th November 2022. To make the world a better place for future generations.

This Cyclothon is the first of its kind in the 
city of Mumbai. It aims to create awareness among citizens about sustainable living and to sensitize
them towards eco-friendly transport options like cycling, which is both affordable & environment 
friendly. With the motto of ‘Public Administration Cycling Interface', we envisage a scenario where citizens and the government come together as one and work towards a greener and more sustainable future.

event_id: Dzień 11 (8.11) Ok 11 rano dobijamy do brzegu.  Kolejny przystanek to Varkala oddalona o 4 h drogi wzdłuż wybrzeża. Lunch w przydrożnej knjapce. Po przyjeździe do hotelu relaks. Wieczorem plaża i zachód słońca nad oceanem.

Dzień 14 (11.11) Przejazd porannym pociągiem do Cochin. Przejazd ze stacji na lotnisko krajowe i lot do Delhi.  Ostatnie zakupy i kolacja na ulicy
Dzień 15 (12.11) Transfer na lotnisko. Wylot do Warszawy. Tego samego dnia jesteście w Warszawie.
Zapraszamy wszystkich :) Ważna jest otwartość i elastyczność. Miłośnicy przygód

event_id: Choć w Indiach oficjalnie jest zima temperatury w lutym na południu są dosyć wysokie: ok. 30-35 stopni w dzień i ok. 20 stopni w nocy.

end_time: krótkie spodnie. Poruszamy się w rejonach turystycznych. Nikogo nie dziwią już odsłonięte ramiona czy nogi. Do zwiedzania świątyń przyda się chusta lub szal. Krem przeciwsłoneczny

eventname: chyba że na zwolnione miejsce znajdzie się kolejna chętna osoba (do 3 miesięcy przed wyjazdem). Pozostałą kwotę bedzie płatna gotówką na miejscu - ważne: tylko banknoty wydane po 2004. Cena wyjazdu może nieznacznie ulec zmianie w zależności od kursu dolara.

eventname: praktykuję jogę wg metody BKS Iyengara od 20 lat. Założyłam i przez wiele lat prowadziłam Equanimus  - Ośrodek Dobrych Praktyk Radzenie Sobie ze Stresem - na moim rodzinnym warszawskim Wilanowie
start_time: gdzie uczyłam jogi i medytacji. Jestem podróżniczką
end_time: ale moje serce skradło Bali i tu zamieszkałam na stałe. Od wielu lat organizuję wyprawy z jogą do Indii oraz na Bali. Mam dwie córki. Z wykształcenia jestem socjologiem. Pasjonuję się ajurwedą.  Jestem wolnym ptakiem
timezone: podążąm za porywami serca

event_id: MARTA GOŁUCHOWSKA - od 11 od mieszkam w Indiach. Przez 8 lat moim domem były Himalaje gdzie prowadziłam wegetariańską knajpkę dla turystów. W Himalajach urodził się mój syn. Na prośbę kilku znajomych zorganizowałam mój pierwszy wyjazd do Indii w 2010. Od tamtego czasu robię wyjazdy mniejsze i większe w różne miejsca Indii. Od niedawna mieszakm na Goa gdzie pomiędzy wyjazdami robię wegańskie ciasta dla lokalnych restauracji. Skończyłam Turystykę Miedzynarodową w UK i moim marzeniem po studiach było przejechać cały świat. Po wylądowaniu w Indiach niemal natychmiast pewne było  ze ja już nigdzie w najblizszym czasie nie pojadę. \"Jestem w domu\" ...to była pierwsza myśl."

eventname: Kusur(A Theatrical Reading) by Amol Palekar, Live In Kolkata
description:
Book tickets on 9123727518/9007171001
or https://in.bookmyshow.com/plays/kusur-the-mistake-by-amol-palekar/ET00122747 
 
Amol Palekar is back after 25 years into theatre for Kusur (A Theatrical Reading) presented by Goonjan, adapted from the Danish Thriller film Den Skyldige, to be performed for a limited period only. Watch the legend perform a thriller, a never seen ever before experience; for the first and last time in Kolkata.


It all begins on a rainy night... when retired Assistant Police Commissioner ASHOK DANDAVATE volunteers his service at a police control room. As the hours go by, anonymous residents of Mumbai seeks help.  With a trail coming up the next day, he gets a call from a woman who he believes has been kidnapped and despite being warned  not to get too emotionally involved, that's what exactly he does. The night presents us with a series of twist and turns, while the end unearths the truth in a way that leaves us holding our breath. 


When DANDAVATE exits the control room, he says, \ I'm indebted to this night.. Good intentions alone don't absolve us of our sins. Thank you Kaveri for helping me realise this.\"

Gandikota and Belum caves are a combination of geological wonders in Incredible India. 
Gandikota Fort is famous for the beautiful gorge on the bank of river Penna. The ruins of Gandikota Fort narrates its history dating back to the 12th century. The fort has 2 beautiful ancient temples (Madhavaraya & Ranganatha Swamy).
Belum caves is the largest cave system open to the public on the Indian subcontinent. Known for stalactite and stalagmite formations, the Belum caves have long passages, galleries, spacious caverns with fresh water and siphons. The cave system reaches its deepest point 46 m (151 ft) from entrance level at the point known as Patalganga. Belum Caves have a length of 3,229 m. It is said that Buddhist and Jain monks meditated here.

11:00 - Checkout from Hotel and move to Belum
14:00 - Explore Belum Caves after Lunch
18:00 - Board 22160 MAS Exp from Tadipatri towards Mumbai

#Monday, 4th Oct

12:00 - Reach Mumbai

eventname: Trail Running Adventure | Jewel of the Middle East, Oman
description:
8-day Trail Running Holiday | Jewel of the Middle East, Al-Hajar Mountains, Oman
17-24 November 2022

An epic trail running adventure in the Middle East. A journey through the mountains, amongst traditional villages and deep into local wadi's leaves you in wonderment. Joins us and experience having the trails to ourselves as we work our way through the Al-Hajar mountain range beneath the highest point in Oman, Jebel Shams. Magnificent escarpments and a real sense of solitude can be found here. We cover 100km on a journey across this landscape and experience the local culture as we travel from one place to the next. 

Day 1 - Arrive and Relax
Day 2 - AM Transfer & Trail run / PM time to explore & unwind
Day 3 - AM Trail Run / PM time to explore & unwind
Day 4 - AM Trail Run / PM time to explore & unwind
Day 5 - AM Trail Run / PM time to explore & unwind
Day 6 - Day off
Day 7 - AM Short trail run / PM transfer back to the city 
Day 8 - Farewells

Since its inception Bangalore Open Air has earned a reputation as one of the biggest and most innovative Rock & Heavy Metal festivals to emerge from the Indian subcontinent. Salman U. Syed founded Bangalore Open Air with the sole purpose of giving metalheads all over India a metal festival they can call their own. After tirelessly working with the world renowned Wacken Open Air Festival from Germany, BOA managed to forge a collaboration that has seen some of the most legendary and cutting edge metal acts grace Indian soil. From thrash titans Kreator and Destruction, to legendary heavy metal stalwarts Iced Earth and extreme metal luminaries like Rotting Christ and Vader, Bangalore Open Air has never failed to pull out all the stops when it comes to booking some of metal's most sought after acts. 

With an annual attendance of three thousand people that grows considerably with every passing year, and a state of the art festival experience that is on par with the best that Europe has to offer, it comes as no surprise that Bangalore Open Air is widely considered by metal fans all over the country as THE metal festival to head to every single year.

eventname: Gita Singing At Kurukshetra for Guru Purnima Mon, 3rd July 2023
description:
Inviting ALL Hindu individuals, Hindu organizations and anyone at all who has faith in the beauty and wisdom of the Bhagavad Gita to plan events / yatras / holidays at Angkor Wat, Cambodia, this and every Gita Jayanti date (dates for future years can be found @ www.bit.ly/GJIEVENTS )   Everyone who comes there is encouraged to honour Mother Gita _in their own way_ with their _own programs_, or join us in singing the entire Gita like a bhajan all together.   Here is how we sing it:   www.bit.ly/gita-k & here is our iOS Apple App:  www.bit.ly/karaokegitaapple

If we want Hindu unity, we need a known/fixed common place and time where many of us can gather in devotion.   From such regular gatherings, many good collaborations may manifest, and better mutual understanding, cooperation & collaboration will evolve.  

For these 2 festivals to manifest annually, there is no need for any complicated meetings / joint committees to be made, nor for any new organizations to be registered, nor complex resolutions drafted...  No... it is soooo simple - just bring your own people and be there with your own program: Same Time & Same Place.  

*This initiative has been acknowledged and strongly supported by the Jagadguru of Sringeri Mutt* - Please see his powerful supporting letter:   

www.bit.ly/HinduUnity  &  www.bit.ly/HindusUnited

For its success, the only things we Hindus need to agree upon are:-

A.   Collectively accept that the Holy Gita is worshippable and so is Her divine author Mahamuni Sri Vyasadeva (BG 18:75)

B.   Collectively accept that these 2 Tithis are very auspicious:- 

i) the Birth Tithi of the Gita (universally celebrated as Gita Jayanti - it falls on Mokshada Ekadasi, Shukla Paksha, Marga Sirsha month) 
and
ii) the Birth Tithi of Sri Vyasadeva, which is universally celebrated as Guru Purnima - it falls on the Full Moon Day in the month of Ashadha

&

C.  Collectively accept as Holy Pilgrim places (Tirthas) Kurukshetra &  the Angkor Wat [Largest temple in the world.]


If we can all accept the above without debate, 
then the only thing we need to do 
to achieve this powerful unity is 
to just go ahead and 
BOOK OUR TICKETS** TO TRAVEL THERE!!!!  

If families, groups or organizations want to come, they can organize their own events there - just synchronize them:  Same Place, Same Time - www.bit.ly/GJIEVENTS

As more and more yatris (pilgrims) gather
at these two Gigantic Tirthas year after year, 
naturally, it will become easier and easier 
for all those involved in promoting Hindu Unity 
to collaborate for joint activities
and thus share their resources, 
synergize and act in unison 
for the greater good of mankind
wherever possible.

How can there possibly be any objection to this?   I doubt it.   Come, with joy let us all wholeheartedly worship and reverberate the holy sound vibration known as the Bhagavad Gita!


===

>>>> T R A V E L    T I P S <<<<

We highly recommend these devotional tour organizers:

1/2  This is absolutely amazing!!!   Pilgrimages taken to the next level - https://www.tirthayatra.org/ & https://www.facebook.com/tirthayatra/ - devotionally!

2/2  This is absolutely amazing!!! Pilgrimages taken to the next level - thegaudiyatreasuresofbengal.com/ - devotionally!
They publish fabulous quality educational books* as well for educating their pilgrims! }

eventname: Gita Singing for Guru Purnima at Kurukshetra, Wed. 13th Jul 2022
description:
Inviting ALL Hindu individuals, Hindu organizations and anyone at all who has faith in the beauty and wisdom of the Bhagavad Gita to plan events / yatras / holidays at Angkor Wat, Cambodia, this and every Gita Jayanti date (dates for future years can be found @ www.bit.ly/GJIEVENTS )   Everyone who comes there is encouraged to honour Mother Gita _in their own way_ with their _own programs_, or join us in singing the entire Gita like a bhajan all together.   Here is how we sing it:   www.bit.ly/gita-k & here is our iOS Apple App:  www.bit.ly/karaokegitaapple

If we want Hindu unity, we need a known/fixed common place and time where many of us can gather in devotion.   From such regular gatherings, many good collaborations may manifest, and better mutual understanding, cooperation & collaboration will evolve.  

For these 2 festivals to manifest annually, there is no need for any complicated meetings / joint committees to be made, nor for any new organizations to be registered, nor complex resolutions drafted...  No... it is soooo simple - just bring your own people and be there with your own program: Same Time & Same Place.  

*This initiative has been acknowledged and strongly supported by the Jagadguru of Sringeri Mutt* - Please see his powerful supporting letter:   

www.bit.ly/HinduUnity  &  www.bit.ly/HindusUnited

For its success, the only things we Hindus need to agree upon are:-

A.   Collectively accept that the Holy Gita is worshippable and so is Her divine author Mahamuni Sri Vyasadeva (BG 18:75)

B.   Collectively accept that these 2 Tithis are very auspicious:- 

i) the Birth Tithi of the Gita (universally celebrated as Gita Jayanti - it falls on Mokshada Ekadasi, Shukla Paksha, Marga Sirsha month) 
and
ii) the Birth Tithi of Sri Vyasadeva, which is universally celebrated as Guru Purnima - it falls on the Full Moon Day in the month of Ashadha

&

C.  Collectively accept as Holy Pilgrim places (Tirthas) Kurukshetra &  the Angkor Wat [Largest temple in the world.]


If we can all accept the above without debate, 
then the only thing we need to do 
to achieve this powerful unity is 
to just go ahead and 
BOOK OUR TICKETS** TO TRAVEL THERE!!!!  

If families, groups or organizations want to come, they can organize their own events there - just synchronize them:  Same Place, Same Time - www.bit.ly/GJIEVENTS

As more and more yatris (pilgrims) gather
at these two Gigantic Tirthas year after year, 
naturally, it will become easier and easier 
for all those involved in promoting Hindu Unity 
to collaborate for joint activities
and thus share their resources, 
synergize and act in unison 
for the greater good of mankind
wherever possible.

How can there possibly be any objection to this?   I doubt it.   Come, with joy let us all wholeheartedly worship and reverberate the holy sound vibration known as the Bhagavad Gita!


===

>>>> T R A V E L    T I P S <<<<

Amol Palekar is back after 25 years into theatre for the play Kusur (The Mistake)- A Theatre Reading, adapted from the Danish Thriller film Den Skyldige, to be performed for a limited period only. Watch the legend perform a thriller, a never seen ever before experience; for the first and last time in Kolkata.


It all begins on a rainy night... when retired Assistant Police Commissioner ASHOK DANDAVATE volunteers his service at a police control room. As the hours go by, anonymous residents of Mumbai seeks help.  With a trail coming up the next day, he gets a call from a woman who he believes has been kidnapped and despite being warned  not to get too emotionally involved, that's what exactly he does. The night presents us with a series of twist and turns, while the end unearths the truth in a way that leaves us holding our breath. 


When DANDAVATE exits the control room, he says, \ I'm indebted to this night.. Good intentions alone don't absolve us of our sins. Thank you Kaveri for helping me realise this.\"

Uttari Betta is one of the most popular trekking trails in Karnataka and that is not without a reason. This five kilometre trek offers all the adventurers stunning views that will be imprinted onto their minds and will be very hard to forget for the rest of their lives. Along with historic views such as those of the fort walls and the intricate stone steps, the trek also has a temple of Shankareswar right at the top. It also takes you right into the middle of nature with the help of caves, jungles and huge boulders that will make you marvel at the immensity of life. It makes sure that the trekkers feel at one with the abundant wildlife and vegetation that its path has to offer. So if you want to completely belong to nature, come along on this trek and get to be a part of something bigger than all of us.



Day 0

Leave Bangalore at 11 PM


Day 1:


- Reach Base at at 2 AM

- Rest at the Base Camp

- Start the trek at 4:00 AM

- Reach The top

- Watch Sunrise

- Start Your Descend at 7:00 AM

- Leave to Bangalore

- On the way stop for Breakfast

- Reach Bangalore by 12:00 PM ( approx )


Trek Inclusions:

- To and Fro Transport ( Non-AC)

- The experience that you gain.

- Lunch - Snacks


Exclusions:

- All meals

- Anything Not included above.

- Any sort of insurance ( medical, accident etc.)

- Personal Expenses ( snacks, mineral water etc.)


Note:

1. Consumption of alcohol, intoxicants, and smoking would not be tolerated during the entire course of the journey. Kindly co-operate with us to make the experience more fun.

2. Put Litter in its place, do not trash the mother earth.

3. In the case of traffic delays or breakdowns expect a few delay in reaching the destination.

Plan The Unplanned presents Kodachadri !!


Kodachadri Trek comprises of a complete package of natural beauty - it possesses compact forests, beautiful waterfalls en route, gorgeous jungle trails, and picturesque landscapes!

Located amidst the Western Ghats of Karnataka, Kodachadri is 1,343 meters above the sea level. Kodachadri Peak has a beautifully painted canvas like backdrop having the famous Mookambika Temple and also the Mookambika National Park.

Being at the heart of this National Park, the wildlife and trekking maniacs explore the lush green hillside views and celebrate the wonders of nature!


TREK DISTANCE

14kms (to and fro)


TREK LEVEL

Easy – Moderate. The difficulty level is subjective.


Day 0 :

- Leave BANGALORE at 21:00 Hrs


Day 1 :

-Reach Homestay – Freshen up & Breakfast

- Bus Ride to Trek Start Point

-Start the Trek

-Hidlumane Falls

-Mookambika Temple

-Kodachadari Summit

-Descend via Jeep Ride

-Dinner and Campfire


Day 2 :

-Visit Maravanthe Beach

-Reach Bangalore by 22:30 Hrs (approx)


Trek Inclusions:

- To and Fro Transport ( Non-AC)

- Meals - Veg Only ( 2 Breakfast, 1 Lunch, and 1 Dinner)

- Jeep Ride

- Forest Permits

- The experience that you gain.

Coming under the Chikmagalur District of Karnataka, Kudremukh trek is one of the most exciting treks in this region. It is the third highest peak after Mullayanagiri and Bababudangiri. Absorb the beauty of the Western Ghats as you walk up the trail. Very few people know the fact that the Western Ghats are considered as UNESCO World Heritage Site for the natural beauty and for being an icon of environmental balance. The lush greenery of the hills can never fail to mesmerize a soul.



You'll cross several cascading waterfalls and narrow streams, thick forests with a variety of trees, and the whistling of birds will keep you entertained all throughout. And finally, when you'll reach the peak, the picturesque view from the top and the chilled wind will absolutely blow you out of your mind and make you numb for a few minutes, before you regain your consciousness to feel the enchanting magic of the place. So if you are bored of the city lights in Bangalore, then forget everything and join us for this weekend trek to Kudremukh and find yourself amidst nature.


Important Notice:

The Forest Department at Kudremukh allows only the first 50 persons (on first come first serve basis) to trek to the Kudremukh Peak in a day. This notification has been passed with a view to preserve the forests and promote eco-tourism in the region. We have been managed to get permissions for Sunday with a group size of about 25.



Trek Dates

Oct - Dec ( All Weekends)


TREK DISTANCE

19 - 21 km (to and fro)


TREK LEVEL

Moderate (difficulty level is subjective).


Day 1 -

- Depart from Bangalore by 5:00 AM

- Refresh yourselves at Elniru falls

-Check the homestay, have dinner and hit the bed early.


Day 2 -

- Wake up early morning at 4 am for early breakfast

- Jeep Ride to the Kudremukh Trek Base

- Start the trek to Kudremukh at 6 AM\\

- Have packed lunch

- Reach the peak and Descend by 5 PM Approx

- Have dinner after the trek

- Depart to Bangalore at 9 PM


DAY 3

- Reach Bangalore by 5 AM (Approx)

Amdavad Crankmeisters Presents

'AAHHOO Group Rides' to serve as a platform for the beginners and pro cyclists where they can learn, share and train together.


An initiative to create a collaborative cycling community and promote competitive cycling as a sport.


Spreading awareness about fitness, structured training benefits, and how to get into cycling for Beginners and Amateur cyclists.


Ride and Learn from professionally experienced and

certified coaches of Amdavad Crankmeisters


We will be hosting a group ride on every first Sunday of the month. Each group ride is designed to provide a specific knowledge and training for a beginner or established cyclist.


The schedule for 2019 year is as follows:


3rd Feb

Learn about

- Cycling etiquettes

- Basic Bike Maintenance

- Stretching and Foam Rolling


7th April

Learn about

- Hydration & Nutrition

- Guidance about bike accessories, upgrades, new bike

- Fitness Test and Zones


5th May

Learn about

- Bike Fit

- Purchasing your first road bike

- Indoor Session and guidance about indoor trainers

- Science of riding the bike


2nd June

Learn about

- Strength and Core exercise

- Race Simulation

- Race Techniques and Tactics


7th July

Learn about

- Climbing, Sprinting, Endurance Efficiency

- Pedal Efficiency

- Using Power Meter and its Zones

- How to use your Garmin device efficiently


It's ideal for those who want to:

Get efficient at cycling

Finish first 100 kms efficiently

Finish 100kms under 3 hours

Increase Average Speed

Injury free rides

Sustain a BRM

Get into coaching


Please Note:

Each Group Ride duration will be from 2 to 3 hrs.

Bring your own bike, hydration, nutrition, or indoor trainer if required.

Helmet is mandatory.
